characters: EVERYTHING YOU'VE TOLD ME WAS A
A68 FROM ACROSS THE RIVER, A68
I/E. MARY LEE'S CAR/PIGGLY WIGGLY PARKING LOT
I/E. CARVER'S LINCOLN/PIGGLY WIGGLY PARKING LOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELLIS(14) sits fully-clothed on top of his made bed. He i wiry young man with a few blonde hairs on his upper lip struggling desperately to be a mustache. His room, cluttered with junk, is dark, quiet and tiny. A backpack and an oversized Walkie-Talkie sit next to him. The silence is cut by a SQUAWK from the Walkie. Ellis quickly grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm comin' out now. He crams the Walkie into his backpack and slings it over shoulder. On his feet, he slides open a window at the foo of his bed. He's out in one motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis skirts alongside the exterior wall of his room on a foot-wide section of decking. He lives on a HOUSEBOAT anchored just off the bank of the Arkansas River. The "boat" is really the combination of a double wide trailer and a vinyl-sided shack fused togethe atop large flotilla. Ellis scurries to the mobile home section of the boat. He slips past a barbecue grill and settles underneath a ligh window. VOICES come from inside. Slowly, Ellis gets on his toes to peer through the window

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY LEE(41) takes a jug of milk out of the refrigerator. SENIOR(52) sits at a small table reading a newspaper. The mobile home kitchenette is no larger than Ellis' room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to have a conversation. I just want to talk about it. Mary Lee sits down across from Senior, who doesn't look u from his paper. Her eyes narrow and she extends a finger toward him.

dialogues.speaker: MARY LEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you don't look up from that goddamn paper... She stops before completing the thought. After a moment, Senior lowers his paper. He stares across the table at his wife. He looks at her with true disdain. 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes trace down her face and robe before finally sett on his cup of coffee. He picks up the cup, takes a sip, a sets it back on the table. He raises the paper up. Mary Lee's eyes soften. She bites the inside of her cheek keep from crying. Her eyes move to the kitchen window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis quickly ducks and mouths the word "shit." He slips under the window toward a metal carport that cov a boat, fish cleaning station, and industrial ice machine The entire houseboat is anchored to the shore by two thic ropes tied to opposite ends of the flotilla. The ropes extend upward into the tops of enormous pine trees. Ellis sprints across a simple, wood-planked bridge to sho His houseboat is one of several in a row along the riverb

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis scurries into the treeline and arrives at a dirt pa Waiting for him there is NECKBONE(14), a scrawny kid with slicked back blonde hair wearing a FUGAZI T-shirt. He sit atop a smallish dirt bike. Ellis hops on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the shit man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suck it. Drive. The bike spits up mud as they peel out down the trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a distance, the single headlight of the dirt bike sn up and down, in and out of trees along the riverbank.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BIKE,
dialogues.text: The sound of the engine rips through fog and trees illuminated by the straining headlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys emerge from behind a sand covered hill. Now on foot, they are silhouetted against a light blue, morning

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Junior. 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a collection of trees growing out of the water, the bo move branches away from a tarp covered boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got nice titties. You talk to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna have to talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remind me when we get back to my house, Galen's got a book on that. Neckbone takes a spot up front in the small, flat-bottom boat. Ellis, a foot on the bank and one in the boat, launches them out into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chunk of Neckbone's greased back hair bobs in the wind they cruise down river. Ellis steers a small 15 horsepowe motor. An orange sun is coming up now. Neckbone's eyes lock on what's in front of them. Ellis ki the motor. Neckbone stands up, a serious look on his face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Ellis raises up behind him. He takes a deep breath, nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dad'd kill us he knew we went out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not worried about my dad killin' us. THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER sprawls out in front of them. It's enormous. Their boat drifts at the mouth of the Arkansas, a small r by comparison. The Mississippi is a swirling mess of brow water and yellow foam six football fields wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it sinks? 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't gonna sink. We gotta move if we're gonna make it back. Set your watch. We'll need a good fifteen minutes. Neckbone sets an alarm on his fat plastic wristwatch. The take their seats. Ellis cranks the motor. The small boat slowly chugs out onto the massive river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat lurches through the murky, rushing water. Neckbone has both hands firmly planted on the boat's edge Ellis tries to handle the motor which has little impact against this current. The tail end of the boat swings to the right. Ellis flinc and grabs an edge to steady himself. The front of the boa bobs toward an ISLAND in the middle of the river. Neck turns to Ellis and points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys splash down in ankle deep water. They take hold the front of the boat and drag it onto the muddy shore. Neckbone jogs to a tree line in the center of the island. Ellis snatches up his backpack and follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The island, only 60 some yards in diameter, is separated clump of tall trees that form a wooded area in its center The trees make it so you can't see from one side of the island to the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen thinks it's been here awhile. Thinks the last flood did it. Ellis follows as Neckbone winds through the trees. They s at a deep creek that cuts across the island. Neckbone loo to his right, then his left. Sees what he's looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's down there. A fallen tree trunk that straddles the creek. Ellis start across. 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it. Neckbone picks a large stone up off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. Eight feet below the tree trunk, a nest of water moccasin curl around in the creek. Neckbone drops the stone on top them. The snakes fan out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little shits. Their mud-caked high-tops stomp across the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys stop near the base of a large tree and stare up. Ellis cranes his neck back. Awestruck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So there it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, there it is. A 26 Foot Long BOAT sits nestled in the tree limbs above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys scale up the tree from low lying branches. Ellis, hands on the edge of the boat, gets a leg over the side and pulls himself onto the deck. He reaches down and helps to drag Neckbone on board. They get to their feet, steadying themselves on the woode deck. It's solid. They take in their new vantage point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It came down from up there. Ellis points to higher limbs that have long been broken o Neckbone walks to the back of the boat and hangs his head over. He finds a gaping hole of gutted wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motor broke off. Ellis isn't concerned with the motor. His eyes are locked a covered cabin at the front of the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else knows about this? 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just me and Galen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He don't care about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Ellis walks to the cabin. He pushes a vinyl door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause this boat's ours. Ellis has to duck down to go inside. Neckbone follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis, stooping over, makes his way into the tiny cabin r Yellow floral curtains, stained with age, cover a row of windows that wrap around the top of the cabin. These prov an odd glow in an otherwise dark, wood paneled space. There is a bench with rotted out cushions to the left. To the right, a mold-covered sink and mirror. Neckbone peers over Ellis' shoulder at the front of the c room. A small booth sits to the right across from a miniature toilet partially shielded by an open door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's got its own shitbox Neckbone slides back a portion of floral curtain and ligh streams in. He starts opening small closets and drawers. Ellis plops down on the rotted bench cushions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho-Lee-Shit. Neckbone stares in an open drawer. He removes a stack of Playboys from the 1980's. Ellis smiles at him. He leans back and props his foot against the sink cabinet across from him. This is home. Neckbone opens the first Playboy. It disintegrates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw shit. 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he scrambles to gather the fallen pages, Ellis notices dried BOOT PRINT next to his foot. He lowers his shoe fro the cabinet leaving a smaller, muddy print of his own. He leans in to examine the larger print. The impression o CROSS has been left in the heel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her tits are so small. Ellis reaches out and traces his finger in the groove of cross marking. His eyes narrow as he re-surveys the cabin On the table across from the toilet, he notices several e cans of Beanie Weenie. In the booth, he sees a grocery ba Ellis slowly raises up and goes over to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that beave. You gotta see this. Ellis reaches out for the plastic bag. His fingers pull b the edges to reveal its contents: one can of unopened Bea Weenie and half a loaf of BREAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neck. Ellis reaches for the bread and gives it a squeeze. It's FRESH. Ellis freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Ellis holds the loaf of bread up to Neckbone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's livin' here. Neckbone sees the grocery bag. His eyes widen. The boys a stone frozen. They listen for other sounds. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: BEEP
dialogues.text: Both boys flinch at the sharp sounds. Neckbone's hand fli to cover the alarm on his wristwatch. 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta go. I can't be late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drop out of the tree and hit the ground running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys' feet rush across the tree trunk bridging the cr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They launch out of the treeline and sprint to their boat. Neckbone grabs the side and starts pushing the boat to th water. Ellis slings his backpack in and joins him. Suddenly, Ellis straightens up, leaving Neckbone to strug

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Ellis stares at a muddy boot print, cross in the heel, stamped in the center of their boat. He looks back to the treeline, then down the shore. He looks to his feet. The boys' shoe prints make chaotic patterns in the mud. Larger boot prints lead off down the shoreline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw that same boot print up in the tree. It has a cross in the heel. Somebody's been in our boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Let's go. Ellis begins following the boot prints around the shoreli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta go if you wanna make it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dad's gonna kick our ass. It'll take twice as long goin' up river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it. 9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis stops and points ahead of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up there. They stop. Neckbone takes the lead, walking up to the last boot prin They appear to vanish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell'd he go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Neckbone turns and freezes. A MAN has appeared in the distance behind Ellis. He stands between the boys and the boat. Ellis notices the look on Neckbone's face and turns. He flinches at the sight of the Man. MUD(38) stands near the boys' boat holding a pink, child' fishing pole with cartoon characters on it. He stares bac at them and casts his fishing line into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. You know that guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never seen him before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Mud, not taking his eyes off the boys, slowly reels in hi line. His hair is a wild mop that leads to two weeks of growth on his face. With a cigarette clinched, he cracks a smile revealing a MISSING CANINE. He holds a hand in the air as if to wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Neckbone slowly raises his hand up to wave back. Mud wear jeans and cowboy boots. His filthy button-up shirt looks like it hasn't left his body in years. He breaks his stare with the boys. Continuing to reel in line, he walks over to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you say? The boys don't respond. Mud walks past them and casts aga 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helluva thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? Mud takes the cigarette from his mouth. A tattoo of a snake's head covers the top of his right hand. Two large cotton blossoms spill out of its jaws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boat in the trees. It's a helluva thing. Mud continues walking down the shoreline, reeling in his bait. The boys follow, tentatively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talkin' 'bout our boat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talkin' about my boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You found it with me livin' in it. Possession is nine tenths of the law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me you boys are from Mississippi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. They watch as he grabs the bait at the end of his line an spits on it. Then, tucking the pole under his arm, he tie lock of his hair into a knot. He finishes this process wi another cast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got crosses in your heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nails. Shaped liked crosses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for? 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ward off evil spirits. A man I called an Indian but was Meskin said they were Seven-league boots worn by the seventh son of a seventh son. Told me it'd turn me into a werewolf but that's a lie. I don't know nothin' about that. Ellis, confused, won't take his eyes off the man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just good luck, but so far they ain't been workin' too well. (missing tooth smile) What's your name? Mud seems easy to smile, which softens his otherwise coar look. His words spill from the mouth rapidly, without muc thought for punctuation. Neckbone, emboldened by these facts, steps forward to answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Neckbone, he's Ellis, and mister you may be stone ass crazy but I know you're not the owner of that boat, not for nine tenths of nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neckbone? That's a real handle son. Where ya'll from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you care where we're from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeWitt. Neckbone looks at Ellis, frustrated by his friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arkansas boys. Ya'll had me worried for a second. Mud, pleased by this news, tucks the fishing pole under h arm and holds out a hand to shake. Ellis stares at the ha unsure. He takes it reluctantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We s'posed to know you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt it. I grew up `round here, but I've been gone awhile. 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where around here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Different places. Spent a lot of time back up near the White.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Shelly's Oxbow? Neckbone can't believe his friend is offering this up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis. We gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it. Guy named Tom Blankenship used to live back in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He still does. His boat's cross from mine. Mud smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't that somethin'. In one motion, Mud flicks his cigarette away and grabs a out of his shirt pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like you two. You remind me of me. And seeing how you boys are from Arkansas and we know some people and sounds like we all from the same place I'd say we can make a deal here about somethin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deal for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Food. Food for a boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy's a bum Ellis. Come on. Mud's smile vanishes. Neckbone begins to walk off but begrudgingly stops when Ellis starts back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you go get your own food? 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would if I could, but I told somebody I'd meet `em here. So I'm stuck for now and what I got's runnin' low. Neckbone walks back and pulls Ellis by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a bum Ellis, let's go. Mud lays a serious look down on Neckbone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm no bum. I got money. You can call me a hobo `cause a hobo'll work for his living and you can call me homeless `cause that's true for now, but if you call me a bum again I'll have to teach you somethin' about respect that your daddy never did. Neckbone's confidence recedes. Ellis stands his ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they show up, you'll leave? Mud begins fishing again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when you leave, that boat's ours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Ellis studies Mud's face, clothes, tattoos. He's thinking about it. Mud pauses from fishing to make eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in a tight spot. I just need a little help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta go. With that, Ellis turns to leave. The boys walk briskly ba to their boat. Ellis looks over his shoulder to see Mud making another cast with his fishing pole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis motors them away from the island. 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get his name?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Ellis looks back. Mud has disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senior heaves an enormous, white cooler into the bed of h weathered pick-up truck. The truck is parked at an angle on a concrete boat ramp n to their houseboat. The bed of the truck is jam-packed wi six of the big, white coolers. The SOUND of a dirt bike rattles through the trees. Senio looks up, wiping his brow with a handkerchief. Ellis leaps out of the treeline and runs to the pick-up. hands hit his knees, out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neck and I got caught up helpin' Galen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're s'posed to be helpin' me. I had to load this myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get in the back. Can't be later than we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir. Senior flips up the tailgate. Ellis hops up the wheel wel and into the bed of the truck. He steadies himself on one the coolers as his father pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 20 -Ellis looks around as he rides in the bed of the pick truck. He's propped up on a cooler against the back windo The truck works its way down a two-lane highway. A20 -Driving, they pass a marina junkyard filled with old and sailing paraphernalia. B20 -Downtown Dewitt. A gas station. A Clinic. Rows of re brick buildings, some abandoned, a small furniture store. C20 -Parked, Ellis fills a grocery sack up with Ziplock b of white fish and ice out of the coolers. -He hops out of the truck and runs the sack of fish to th front door of a house. An elderly black man waits there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis sits in the bed of the truck eating a chili dog. Senior is up front wolfing down a cheeseburger. A GROUP of TEENAGERS are gathered around a CLUSTER of par cars in the corner of the lot. They meander between the vehicles, smoking, gossiping, passing around a bottle of Boone's Farm. Ellis watches them. MAY PEARL(16) appears in the middle of the Group laughing with her GIRLFRIENDS. She's pretty and physically more mature looking than Ellis. He watches as a SKINNY KID takes his ballcap off and puts on May Pearl's head. She sniffs the cap, gags and tosses back at him. Her friends laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go son. Ellis crumples the wrapper to his finished hotdog and jum down from the bed of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. SENIOR'S TRUCK/TWO-LANE ROAD
dialogues.text: Ellis rides up front with his father. Senior is a reserved man, older than Ellis' mother by sev years. He's got thinning hair under the cap that only lea his head when he sleeps. He reaches into his shirt pocket and fishes out a fold of cash. He slips out a five dollar bill and hands it to Ell

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's s'posed to be ten. 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ten you do your share. I loaded this mornin'. That makes it five. Ellis begrudgingly stuffs the five in his jeans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You drop me at Neck's? Senior checks his pants pockets, feels around under his s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hadn't you seen enougha him today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Said he had something for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see anymore Ding Dongs over there? Ellis checks under his seat and pulls out a half-empty bo Ding Dongs. Hands one over to his father who rips the package with his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd Momma wanna talk to you about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This mornin', what'd she wanna talk with you about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You spy on me in my own house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't spyin', just heard ya'll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your mother's business. Senior makes this his answer, eats the Ding Dong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neckbone sits on the front steps of his trailer reading a comic book. The muffled sound of the Beach Boys' "Help Me Rhonda" plays off a record inside. Senior's truck pulls away as Ellis walks up the entrance the trailer park. 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came by for that book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What book?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said Galen had a book might help me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, yeah. We gotta give it a minute. You hear that music?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That means he's doin' it. That's his doin' it song. Ellis takes a seat next to Neckbone. They listen to the song, slightly craning their necks to pick up on any othe sounds. There are none.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know who it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever's drivin' that white Dodge. Neckbone motions to a beat up Dodge Shadow in the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell Galen 'bout this morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. You tell anybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That guy was crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. I don't know. I think he just needed some help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well he can swim his ass off that island and get some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm gonna go back, take him some food. 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Suddenly, the music from inside stops. Footsteps approach and the trailer door flies open, almost hitting the boys. A GIRL(28) bursts out down the steps, straight to her car She wears tight jean-shorts and is buttoning a white shir She stops and turns back to the boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Neckbone right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like a good enough kid. A word of advice, don't grow up to be like your shit heel uncle. The boys can't take their eyes off her cleavage revealed under her half-buttoned shirt. A necklace with three misshapen pearls hangs from her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! She snaps the boys' attention up to her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear me? You treat a woman like a princess. Got it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. The trailer door opens and GALEN(36) emerges. He's a big, lumbering guy wearing a full-body wet suit pulled halfway down. A faded mermaid tattooed in the middle of his chest

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on baby.

dialogues.speaker: I'M A GODDAMN PRINCESS
dialogues.text: The Girl yanks off the necklace and hurls it at Galen. He brushes fingers through his thick mustache.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's uncalled for. He walks out to her. She heads for the Dodge Shadow. 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of people are comfortable with that kind of thing in the bedroom. Some people aren't. We know that about you now... Ellis sees one of the misshapen pearls at his feet. He pi it up and holds it to the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pearls. Galen finds 'em in some of the mussel shells. Most of 'em ain't worth dick, but he likes to make necklaces for the girls. Come on, let's get that book. Neckbone walks into the trailer. Ellis stands up and retrieves the other two pearls out of the dirt. He crams them in his pocket and follows Neckbone inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trailer is decorated in the filth of a true bachelor Neckbone makes his way to a bedroom. He tosses clothes an trash around to get to what he's looking for. A cardboard box. He pulls the box onto the bed and sifts through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you goin' back out there by yourself. That river's scary enough with two people, and I don't trust that guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here it is. He takes out a hardback book. The slip reads, "The Confid Confidant, communicating with the opposite sex."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen said this really turned things around for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Ellis flips delicately through the manual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen watches as the Girl's Dodge Shadow pulls away. The boys step out of the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really going back out there? 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's the right thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...I'll be over in the mornin' then. Galen, his thumbs tucked under his armpits, walks back to trailer. He passes the boys and notices the self-help boo in Ellis' hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a good book. Be sure you do the worksheets in the back. Let's get some dinner Neck. Galen's gone inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call 'fore I come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Neckbone follows his uncle into the trailer. Ellis flips through his new book as he heads out of the trailer park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the time Ellis makes it to his houseboat, the sun has disappeared behind the horizon. He crosses the make-shift plank and enters through a scre door by the carport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Lee flinches when she sees Ellis come through the do Her face is flushed. Senior stands toe to toe with her. They stare at Ellis, who has paused in the doorway. He doesn't say anything, just looks curiously at his parents Senior storms past Ellis and is out the door. Ellis steps further into the den. Mary Lee tries to straighten herself, patting down her hair and dabbing at eyes with the back of her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay momma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks into the kitchen keeping Ellis at her back. She turns on the sink and begins scrubbing at a dish.

dialogues.speaker: MARY LEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you need me to fix you somethin'? Have you eaten?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm all right. Mary Lee shuts off the water and lets the dish rest in th sink. She turns to Ellis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna turn in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay momma. Mary Lee slips past him and enters her bedroom. The door closes and Ellis is left alone in the den. It's quiet. He waits, looking at the door his mother just closed. Ellis walks into the kitchen and eases open a cabinet doo Checking over his shoulder, he zips his backpack open and fills it with CANNED FOOD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands pump the stock of a high-powered pellet gun. TOM BLANKENSHIP(67), white hair cut high and tight wearin short-sleeve button up, takes careful aim with the pellet gun. Tom sits in a lawn chair atop the roof of his houseboat. squeezes his left eye shut. A snake's head pokes out of the water about 15 yards off boat. The head makes for a target no bigger than a thumb. Tom's left eye snaps open and he fires. The pellet rips through the snake's head. Its body floats to the surface. Tom takes account of his shot as he pumps the air rifle. scans the water for more targets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis watches Tom Blankenship from across the bayou. Tom' boat sits directly opposite Ellis', separated by 30 yards muddy brown water. Ellis leans against a post under the carport. His backpac resting at his feet, he holds the Walkie-Talkie in his ha Senior works behind him washing utensils in the outdoor s 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you know about Tom Blankenship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Senior doesn't turn around from his work at the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Blankenship, what do you know about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. He looks lonely over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some people move to this river to work on it, and some move here to be left alone. Senior makes his way to the ice machine and begins scoopi ice into a large white cooler. Mary Lee emerges from the houseboat dressed for work, a secretarial job. Senior stops what he's doing to watch he She walks over to Ellis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's sit down for dinner tonight okay? Will you make it home by seven?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes ma'am. She walks off the boat without a glance in Senior's direction. He trails her with his eyes before going back digging in the ice. A29 Ellis looks back at Tom. The Walkie SQUAWKS out sever loud BEEPS. Ellis crams it in his backpack and runs off t boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye Dad. Senior holds a hand up but never looks up from his work. 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water laps at the shore of the island. Ellis and Neckbone drag their boat onto the muddy bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you think he's at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we should try the boat. They head for the treeline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys emerge from the woods, their attention focused u the boat hovering in the tree some twenty feet above them Ellis notices the remnants of a fire on the ground. A log pushed up next to it for a seat. Ellis kicks at the ash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like he made camp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up to the boat) You think he's up there?

dialogues.speaker: MUD, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I didn't know if ya'll'd come back. The boys spin around. They survey the woods but no one's there. Their eyes drift up to find Mud sitting in a tree, his legs dangle off a branch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doin'? Mud bounds down, stepping from limb to trunk to the groun It's an agile move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I try to never sleep in the same place twice. What you got there? Mud motions with his head to the backpack in Ellis' hand. Ellis holds it out to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought you some food. Mud looks at the backpack, but doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on. 24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud takes the backpack and walks over to the ashes of his campfire. He squats with his back to the boys and unzips bag. Hunkered down, Mud's shirttail rides up over the lip his jeans revealing a PISTOL at his backside. Ellis sees this and motions to Neckbone. The boys stand their ground, cautious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I owe you boys. Keeping the bag in hand, Mud takes a seat on the stump be him. He pulls out a selection of canned food; pumpkin pie filling, evaporated milk, green beans. He grabs the beans

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was gonna try runnin' a trot line today. See how far that'd get me. Mud removes a good-sized folding knife from his pocket an makes short order of the can lid. He tips the can up lett the beans fall into his mouth. Juice flows down his cheek

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd been rationin' what I had...green bean never tasted so good. The can is quickly emptied, juice running down Mud's chin He straightens his back, choking down the final swallow. sees the boys staring at him and catches himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you got that pistol for? Mud wipes off his chin, realizing the boys have been stud him. He closes the knife and tucks it in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For protection. Mud gets up, heads for a duffel bag tucked under a nearby tree. The boys pivot, keeping Mud in front of them. Mud notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya'll don't have to be afraid of me. I have two ways to protect myself out here. This shirt, and this pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are fierce powers at work in the world boys. Good, evil, poor luck, best luck. Men have to take advantage where they can. Mud removes a spool of fishing line and a small plastic tackle box. He scoops up the duffel bag and heads into th woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya'll comin'? 32 Neckbone looks to Ellis, who walks after Mud into the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's this guy you're waitin' on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not waitin' for a guy. I'm waitin' on my girlfriend. Juniper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she hot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best lookin' girl I've ever seen. Hands down. Blonde hair. Long legs. She's like a dream you don't want to wake up from. She's got birds tattooed on her hands, here. Mud stops, points to the area on the top of his right han between his thumb and pointer finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nightingales. Good luck birds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That a good luck snake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it is not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate snakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because God made them for us to fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a thing we knew to be afraid of before we even got into this world. 33 They emerge from the woods onto the downstream coast o the island. It looks different than the other shoreline. A large swath of red clay angles sharply into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cherokee would wrap snake skin around their pregnant women's bellies. Induce labor, scare the child out. Here. He fetches a length of rope out of the duffel bag and tos it to Neckbone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set that `round your bed at night. Snake won't cross braided rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. (nods to Mud's tattoo) So what's that for then? Mud walks to a tree branch that has grown out over the ba nearly resting in the water. He sets a trot line from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A reminder. Don't get bit. I was 10, swimmin' `bout a mile up from here. Me and Juniper. Sonofabitch swam right up under me, bit me just below the armpit. June got me out, got me to a clinic. Doctor said I shoulda been dead in twenty minutes. Took us an hour just to get back to town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd they do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gave me antivenom. For a cotton mouth. See here. Mud shows the tattoo on top of his right hand. He points the two cotton blossoms bulging from the snake's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Problem with antivenom is they can only give it to you once. It's made from horse blood. Your body would reject it a second time. The cure ends up being more dangerous than the poison. 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens if you get bit again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I die, or just sweat it out. Neckbone, not buying it, looks at Ellis and taps his watc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta go help Neck's uncle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never said your name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud. You can call me Mud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud?

dialogues.speaker: M-U-D.
dialogues.text: Neckbone tosses the braided rope back. It lands at his fe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go, Mud. I think you need that worse than I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be all right. The boys disappear back into the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A switch clicks "ON". BLINDING LIGHT emits from two FLOOD LAMPS encased in plastic shells. The switch clicks "OFF" the lights dim to the dull orange glow of their filaments

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look bright enough. The owner of the shop, an ELECTRICIAN(62), holds up a met bar with the lamps affixed by bolts at either end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should be. I rigged DC power up through marine batteries. Makes it portable. Gave you a rigging bar to set on your shoulder. 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you really think these'll work under water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In theory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis and Neckbone sit on the tailgate of Galen's truck. Gary's Electric sign hangs behind them. Neckbone focuses on a carburetor in his hand. Ellis stare across the street at the Piggly Wiggly parking lot where roving GROUP of TEENAGERS have collected for the afternoo The Teenagers are up to their typical gossip and minor offenses. Ellis has zeroed in on May Pearl again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You start datin' I bet her dad'll give you a free pick-up truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care about that. Ellis watches as the same Skinny Kid from before tries to flirt with her. She's not having it. He pops her bra stra before landing the final straw, a smack on her ass. She turns and swats at him. Seeing this, Ellis is on his feet and crossing the street

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's goin' on? Ellis doesn't turn back. Neckbone reluctantly sets the carburetor down and follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it! She shoves the Skinny Kid, but he continues laughing.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey. Ellis taps the Kid on the shoulder. As he turns, Ellis PUNCHES him in the face. The Kid, completely taken off guard, stumbles and trips t the ground. Some older, tougher looking GUYS see this and begin laughing at him. 29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit Pryor, get off your ass. Pryor collects himself and gets off the ground. Ego bruis he walks off mumbling. The Older Kids keep riding him. May Pearl sizes up Ellis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't have to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was messin' with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I know you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Ellis. That's Neck. Neckbone waves by wagging a finger in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We went to Junior High with you, before you went to High School.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourteen? You know you just punched a Senior?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you're pretty tough. Ellis shrugs, not wanting to deny it.

dialogues.speaker: MAY PEARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm May Pearl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin'. She smiles. 30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something catches Neckbone's attention. He cranes his nec forward to get a better look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch...Ellis? Ellis breaks away from his conversation with May Pearl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. Neckbone nods to a cheap motel called the EXECUTIVE INN located on the opposite side of the Piggly Wiggly parking lot. JUNIPER(35), a truly beautiful woman squeezed into tight jeans and a low cut top, makes her way from the motel par lot to the Piggly Wiggly. She passes in front of the cluster of Teenagers. All of t boys have taken note. Some cat calls from the crowd. Juniper, without facing the Teenagers, gives them the fin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever seen that girl before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Did you see her hands?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Ellis catches himself and turns back to May Pearl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. We know a guy we think might know that girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. A GIRLFRIEND(17) of May Pearl's calls out to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May Pearl! Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I'll see you. 30A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you can find my phone number, you should call it. 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can find it. May Pearl walks over to her friend. Ellis watches her go, but then remembers Juniper. He turns to Neckbone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd she go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into the Piggly Wiggly. She came from the motel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna go see if it's her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go check on Galen. We'll pick you up out front. Ellis heads for the Piggly Wiggly. Neckbone calls after h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd she say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wants me to call her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis walks past the grocery aisles looking for the girl. spots her by the potato chips. He tucks behind a display stacked cans and watches. Juniper reaches for a bag of chips, birds tattooed on her hand. Ellis smiles. It's her, and she really is beautiful She turns down the aisle, coming right for him. He preten to peruse the canned food and notices that it's a big dis of Beanie Weenie. He grabs two handfuls as she passes. Ellis takes the cans to an open register. As a CASHIER sc and bags his items, he cranes his neck looking for her. She's disappeared into another section of the store. Ellis pays in crumpled cash. A horn HONKS. He sees Galen' truck idling out front. He grabs the bag and runs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neckbone waits at the open passenger door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it her? 32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's her. I saw the tattoos. He wasn't lyin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No he wasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the time Ellis makes it back home, the sun has gone fr the sky. He crosses the makeshift plank to board his hous

dialogues.speaker: SENIOR, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Home for dinner? Ellis is startled by his father's voice. Senior sits in a lawn chair under the eaves of the carport. He's hidden in shadow, save for a red glow from the tip of his cigarette

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you hidin' for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't hidin'. He notices Senior tip back a pint of liquor and set it at feet. Ellis opens the screen door leading inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come over here. Ellis lets the door fall shut and skulks over to a beam t supports the carport. He leans into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I love you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir. I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I work you hard 'cause life is work. You know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Mamma's been talkin' 'bout movin' in town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that mean? 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She seems set on it. Wants to separate. She may ask me for a divorce. This hits Ellis like a ton of bricks. He rights himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that mean for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means enjoy the river son. Enjoy it while you live on it, 'cause this way a life isn't long for this world. Game and fish's 'bout made certain of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you and me can still live out here. Game and fish can't take your boat. Not while you're still in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The houseboat's in your mother's name. Her daddy give it to her not me. If she wants to leave it, Game and Fish has ever' right to take this boat apart board by board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that ain't right. You work outta here. We got the ice machine, the traps. What are we supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said, this is your mother's business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't no townie. I ain't livin' like that. Senior takes a slow pull off the bottle. Ellis' mind race

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've let you down. A man should be in charge of his own affairs, but I haven't worked it like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But ya'll are married. Ya'll are s'posed to love each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know about that anymore. 34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis is speechless. After a moment, he turns to go insid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis? He stops and turns back to his father. Senior tries to express a sentiment he doesn't have the words for. Ellis continues inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Lee sits hunched at the made dinner table. She runs finger around the rim of a half empty glass of iced tea. It's a full spread with fried chicken, mashed potatoes, a salad. The table is set for two. She's been waiting. Ellis lets the front door slam shut behind him. She sits

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're late. Ellis doesn't speak, he doesn't look at her. He enters hi room and shuts the door. He's heard the news and she knows it. Mary Lee's face dro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis slings his backpack down, pacing the small room. He stops and leans his forehead against the door. The sound his Mother clearing the table seeps through. He kicks the door, cracking its shitty composite wood. Hi face flushed and his breathing heavy, he slides to a seat On the verge of hyperventilating, he stares out the dark bedroom window trying to get control of his breathing. Ellis looks at his backpack. It has spilled open revealin can of Beanie Weenie. Ellis studies the can. He looks back to the window. His breathing settles. Quickly, he scoops up the backpack and heads out the wind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pitch black. The only light comes from the moon's reflection off the surface of the water. Ellis, eyes wide, navigates the small boat through choppy black water. 35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis struggles to pull the boat onto shore. Leaving it h in the water, Ellis looks around. No sign of Mud. He size up the dark woods. He removes a flashlight from his backpack and shines it d the shorelines. Still nothing. Ellis follows the beam of light into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis stands at the creek that cuts through the island. He can make out a campfire glowing through trees in the distance. A RUSTLING behind him. He swings the light around. Nothing but trees. Ellis takes a deep breath. Finding the log to cross, he shines his light down into the creek. The nest of snakes show their backs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A campfire burns at the base of the tree. The firelight illuminates the belly of the boat that rests 20 feet abov Ellis, his flashlight off, crouches behind a tree and wat the campsite. There is no one there. He looks into the black forest behind him, thinks of going back. A twig snaps in the distance and he's back on guard. Elli nervously scans the woods before finally stepping into th light of the campfire. The SOUND of a gun's hammer drawing back CLICKS behind hi Ellis freezes. Mud emerges from the trees, a .45 extended toward Ellis' back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis? Ellis, still frozen, slowly turns to him. Mud huffs out a laugh and drops the pistol to his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doin' out here? Ellis slowly raises the backpack in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got you some Beanie Weenie. Mud tucks the pistol into his jeans and accepts the backp 36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate that, but I didn't expect you out here at night. Mud takes a seat on the log and transfers the cans into h own duffel bag. He holds up a can of the Beanie Weenie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that. You really know how to do somebody right. I didn't wanna say anything before, but it's hard to make a meal out of pumpkin pie filling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all my mom had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not complainin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get one of those?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're yours to begin with. Ellis sits as Mud hands him a can. They eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I missed my dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been out here too long. Mud laughs. Finishing the can, he takes a half-smoked cigarette from his shirt pocket. He pulls a twig from the fire for a light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl you're waitin' on, she's your girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juniper. Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you meet her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We grew up together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you love her? 37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. The first time I saw her was on this river. Just up from here. She saved my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the snake bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. I was younger than you are now, but when I came to in the hospital and she was there, it was like the world split open, came back together new. Everything changed. I knew from then on I'd do anything for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why aren't ya'll married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've asked. Several times. Marriage just doesn't work for some people. Ellis thinks on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad says my parents may be gettin' a divorce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to hear that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it happens, and my mom moves us off the river, they say the government can come take our boat away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who says that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody. They passed a law so you can't sell your boat. Can't rent it. If the owner leaves, they got you. Game and Fish want `em off the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never been one to trust the government on matters of personal property, but if your parents love each other, there's always a chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People just sometimes forget why they fell in love in the first place. Ellis watches Mud toke the cigarette nub. He's really getting all he can from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw Juniper today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't talk to her, but she had the birds tattooed on her hand like you said. You were right. She's pretty. Mud stands, surprised by the news. He walks to the other side of the fire so his back is to the boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you see her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the Piggly Wiggly. I think she's stayin' at a motel by there. The Executive Inn. Mud looks at Ellis through the fire. He takes a drag and smiles at the boy. The hole from his missing tooth shows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good news. Real good news. Mud paces, slowly. He's thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does she know you're out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We picked another place to meet. Couple days from now. Mud walks back to the log and sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna go tonight? I can give you a ride up river. Mud looks at Ellis, nodding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow. I'll go tomorrow. 39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need me to come get you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw. I can manage. Hell I got out here didn't I? Ellis smiles. They sit in silence. Ellis stares up at the boat hanging over them, its peeling hull lit by the firelight. Mud pinches the ash from the end of his cigarette, places stub back in his shirt pocket. Noticing Ellis, Mud tilts head back to take in the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a helluva thing. Mud pauses, his mind working on something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helluva thing. The two sit by the campfire staring up at the suspended b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Lee knocks on her way into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to get up. She begins picking clothes off the floor. Ellis, in bed, raises up on his elbows. He's tired from a late night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Saturday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to Wal-Mart. I need you to come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. She pulls the covers off of him.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. MARY LEE'S CAR/INTERSTATE
dialogues.text: The two ride in an awkward silence. 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis stares at the farmland passing by outside as Mary L steers the compact Toyota down a four-lane interstate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis I know what your father told you last night. That's not what I wanted. I wanted to sit you down and talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you wanna talk about? You want to leave and that means they can tear up our house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've spent my whole life on that boat. I don't think it's too much to ask for your... Mary Lee is interrupted by a line of traffic backed up in front of her. She slows to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: MARY LEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh no. I hope no one's hurt. There are flashing police lights up ahead. Ellis tries to see what's going on but can't make anything out past the of cars. They inch forward.

dialogues.speaker: MARY LEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm just saying there are two sides to this. I haven't made up my mind about anything because I want you to be involved in my decision, but I need a change Ellis. I deserve one. As they approach the flashing lights, they see three Stat Trooper vehicles parked to funnel traffic down to one lan The STATE TROOPERS stop each car, checking the trunks.

dialogues.speaker: MARY LEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I think they're searching people. A Trooper signals Mary Lee to pull up to a stop. Two othe Troopers approach her vehicle. The first begins looking i her back windows as the second leans down to speak to her She lowers her window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you open the trunk please ma'am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. 41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Lee pulls the lever by her knee, and the second Troo walks around the back of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you picked up or seen any hitchhikers today ma'am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir. The Trooper produces a flier with a color photo on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen this man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir. The Trooper leans over and holds the paper out to Ellis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son, have you seen this man? Ellis looks at the photo. It's of Mud. He looks exactly t same as he did last night, down to the shirt. In the phot Mud's smiling, revealing his missing tooth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've had reports that he's in this area. If you see him, call 9-1-1 immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will officer. The Trooper pulls his head from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd he do?! The Trooper bends back down and looks at Ellis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd he do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move along please. Mary Lee pulls forward and speeds back up on the intersta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My lord. (rolls up her window)

dialogues.speaker: MARY LEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How would you feel about moving into town with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't tell your father this, but I've been looking at a couple of places. I know it would be a big adjustment for you, but it might end up being something you like. You know living on the river isn't exactly everyone's idea of the good life. Ellis? He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: MARY LEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you even listening to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis busts through the door, grabs his backpack and is g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis is off the houseboat and running up the bank. He heads down the dirt path, grabbing the Walkie Talkie o of his backpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the Walkie) Neck! Neck, pick up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis removes branches and readies the flat bottom boat t launch. The sound of Neckbone's bike arrives before he do Neckbone crests the sand covered slope. He dismounts and starts to chain the bike up to a tree trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the big deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom and I were headed to Wal- Mart on 165. There was a roadblock with state troopers. They searched our car and showed us a picture of Mud. They're lookin' for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it! I told you that crazy sonofabitch was trouble. Did they say what he did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So'd you tell `em where he is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. That's why I called you. We gotta warn him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's goin' to get Juniper today. I went out there last night and told him where we saw her. He needs to know people are lookin' for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he doesn't know that already? Jesus Ellis, why do you think he's on that island? You don't even know what he's wanted for. Ellis climbs in the boat and Neckbone yanks his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis! I'm serious. We don't know who this guy is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He loves her Neck. He told me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a shit who he loves. Ellis starts the motor and waits for his friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not dangerous. Reluctantly, Neckbone throws his leg into the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds like a shitload of state troopers think different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis and Neckbone emerge from the woods at Mud's campsit They scan nearby tree limbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No tellin' where the hell he's been sleepin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He may already be gone. 44.

dialogues.speaker: MUD, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey! The boys look straight up. Mud leans over the edge of the boat above them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up here! Mud drops them a rope with knots tied in it. Ellis starts inching his way up. Neckbone begrudgingly follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis pulls himself over the edge of the boat. He finds M sitting in the swivel chair behind the steering wheel. He writes in an open spiral notebook with a black Sharpie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna have to go back on our deal for the boat. I don't feel good about it, but I don't see any other way outta what I'm into. Neckbone makes his way on board. Mud has pulled a panel o the steering column. Exposed wires dangle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you know about the state troopers? He looks up from his notebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What state troopers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ones spreadin' your picture all over the place. Stoppin' cars on 165 searchin' for your ass. Mud factors this in and then goes back to writing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know about that, but it doesn't surprise me. There plenty of folks lookin' for me right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shot a man. Killed him. 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud stands and walks to the back of the boat. The boys' e follow him cautiously. Mud lifts a hatch at the back that would typically house batteries and engine wiring. There's nothing left but a h into the trees. He makes a note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I didn't tell ya'll sooner, but I was hopin' to be gone before anything came of it. Didn't want you involved. Mud turns to really face them for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya'll have been real good to me. You're the only friends I got out here. If the state troopers have 165 blocked, they'll have others blocked too. I won't get anywhere in a car. I want to try takin' this boat down, see if we can get it in the water. Ellis and Neckbone stand their ground. They don't say anything. Mud walks back to the steering column. He drops his knees and fiddles with the wires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a boat like this I can make it to the gulf in two days. I could get anywhere from there. But I'd need a boat at least this big to make it on open water. It's got no title, no owner, nobody lookin' for it. It's my best shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who'd you kill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a bad piece of business. Ya'll don't need to hear about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to hear about it. Mud sits up. He looks at Ellis, deciding how much to tell

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juniper made a mistake. She hooked up with a guy. He was no good. His name was Hutchins. Family owns a chain of restaurants down in Texas. 46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was around, but me and Juniper were on the outs. She met this Hutchins, he sold her on some lies. Got her pregnant. That's when he started showin' who he really was. He dropped June down a flight of stairs after whoopin' her half to death. She lost the baby. He made it so the doctors think she can't have children anymore. There're things you can get away with in this world and things you can't. I tracked him down at a motel just outside of San Antonio. He was there with another woman. That's where it happened. Mud's done with his story. He goes back to the wiring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand if you can't help me anymore, but I need this boat. And I need to get it in the water fast. After a moment, he sits up and wipes sweat from his foreh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've made a list. Things we'll need. What do ya'll think? Ellis takes time to consider everything. He looks at Neckbone, who has a disgruntled look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did it for her? To protect her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Ellis nods. Mud looks over at Neckbone, who still has the disgruntled look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you want us to run around, stickin' our necks out, gettin' everything you need, just so you can take our boat. 47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's about it. Mud removes a cigarette butt and sparks it with a lighter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we get out of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want? Neckbone looks to Ellis, judging his bargaining position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about that pistol? Mud eyes the boy, pulling on the nub of cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only got two things out here worth anything. This shirt... Mud pulls the pistol from the back of his jeans. Neckbone tenses, but relaxes when Mud splays it out on an open pal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this pistol. I can't give you the shirt `cause I need it for protection, but if you help me get this boat in the water, the pistol's yours. Neckbone squinches his face in thought, sizing up this tr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A forty five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we could work a deal like that. Neckbone steps forward to grab the pistol, but Mud puts i back in his jeans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We get this thing floatin' first. Neckbone looks over at Ellis, who shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right then. 48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud smiles, flashing his missing tooth. He spits in his p and holds it out to Neckbone. Neckbone, not sure about taking the spit hand, reluctantly shakes. Mud rips a page from the notebook and hands it to Ellis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya'll scrounge what you can off this list, but if we're gonna get this done right we'll need more help. Can you fetch Tom for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom Blankenship? Mud has smoked down to the filter. He crushes the butt in his palm and puts it back in his shirt pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was hopin' to let that old assassin stay put, but we'll need him to get things ya'll can't. Can you find him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know where he lives, but I've never spoke to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell him my name. He'll know you're serious. Ellis folds the list up. He and Neckbone start down the r as Mud goes back to the wiring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Ellis nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't lose my pistol. They continue down the rope. Mud continues his work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis steers to the southern mouth of Shelly's Oxbow, the bend in the river that holds he and Tom Blankenship's houseboats, among others. He grounds the boat just shy of entering the Oxbow and st over Neckbone to hop onto the bank. 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You comin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll watch the boat. Ellis scans the woods that populate the patch of land wed between the river and this short tributary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful. Galen always said that old man's crazy. Neckbone keeps his seat as Ellis darts into the woods

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis prowls around the small pine trees and bushes. He pauses, seeing the entrance to Tom Blankenship's boat. Something moves on the houseboat. Ellis hunkers down behi a bush. He sees Tom wrapping cable onto a metal spool. Ellis is nervous. He checks over his shoulder, nothing bu woods. When he looks back to the boat, Tom is gone. In a crouch, Ellis moves closer. Taking a deep breath, Ellis steps out from the cover of t pine trees and heads up a walkway that leads onboard.

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Why you huntin' me? Ellis flinches. He turns to find Tom Blankenship standing the edge of the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You deaf boy? I said why're you huntin' me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't huntin you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your business here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came to find you. I got a message for you. 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Senior's boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you got to say he can't tell me himself? Tom, rusty on pleasantries, brushes past Ellis as he head inside the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't from him. Ellis, not wanting to follow further, shouts from the pla

dialogues.speaker: MUD SENT ME
dialogues.text: There is a silence. Then footsteps. Tom reappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud sent you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you know about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He asked me to come get you. Tom straightens his back. He looks into the woods, search for something he may have missed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your daddy know this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir. Mud needs your help. Tom's mind churns on a series of facts unknown to the boy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neckbone bounces in the boat as it shifts in the choppy Mississippi water. His eyes are locked on the back of Tom head. Tom rides stone faced in the front. Neckbone turns back to Ellis and raises his eyebrows as i ask, "What's going on?". Ellis shrugs. 51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis runs the boat on shore. Tom splashes into the ankle deep water and helps the boys drag it onto the bank. Ellis takes the lead, walking ahead and scanning the treeline. Mud steps out, just past the shadow of the wood Ellis turns to Tom and points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is. Tom spits onto the muddy bank and makes his way toward Mu Ellis and Neckbone stay by the boat and watch.

dialogues.speaker: BY THE TREELINE,
dialogues.text: Mud watches Tom approaching. He corrects his posture and feebly attempts to smooth some wrinkles from his shirt. Tom stops in front of him, his eyes pinched in the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir. They stare at each other for a long moment. Neither one flinching.

dialogues.speaker: BY THE BOAT,
dialogues.text: At this distance, the boys can't hear what is being said, they try and size up the situation through body language.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think that's his dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In town. Got here yesterday. Tom lowers his head. Frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you out here like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys see Mud take a seat on a nearby stump. He's explaining something. Tom listens, standing over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't look like family. Ellis watches Mud as he gestures and speaks. He seems different. Younger. Mud stops talking. Tom scratches a hand through his white crew cut. He begins pointing a finger at Mud. His face is flushed and the sound of his voice carries to the boys, though still unintelligible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's really givin' it to him.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE TREELINE,
dialogues.text: Mud's head hangs as Tom shouts at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've spent your whole life followin' that girl! She's run you halfway cross the country and back, and for what? For this, left out on an island beggin' for help. A murderer. A thief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't no thief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you call it then? Don't even mention draggin' those boys into this. Do you have any idea what you're doin'? Waits for a response, but Mud gives none.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ashamed of you. Mud looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't expect help from me. There's none to be given.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BOAT,
dialogues.text: They see Tom turn his back on Mud and head toward the boa Mud doesn't protest; he doesn't move. Tom brushes past Ellis. 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ready. Tom shoves the boat back into the water. Neckbone helps h Ellis looks back at Mud, who still hasn't moved from his stump. He goes to him. Tom sees this and stops pushing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE TREELINE,
dialogues.text: Ellis stops a good six feet back from where Mud sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right? Mud raises his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like we're on our own. He stands and takes a folded piece of paper from his shir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want you bein' the one to do this, but I can't see a way around it. I need to get this letter to Juniper. Could you take it to her for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.
