dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to be careful. You can't just walk up and knock on her door, you hear me? You have to watch yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can handle it. Ellis steps forward and Mud hands over the note. Ellis ta it and walks back to the others.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BOAT,
dialogues.text: Tom stares at Ellis as he climbs on board. Tom looks back at Mud, who is watching him. He gives the boat a final shove before pulling himself in. They motor away. Tom doesn't look back. 54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You Mud's daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud didn't have no daddy. No mother I ever knew of. He was livin' in the woods when I met him. Younger than you are now. Tom doesn't offer anymore. Neckbone thinks on his answer. Ellis kills the engine near the mouth of Shelly's Oxbow. jumps down into the knee deep river and wades onto shore. turns back to the boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya'll need to watch yourselves. Don't go gettin' into something you don't have any business in. Mud's into something you don't want any part of. I suggest you forget about him. Ellis and Neckbone don't respond. Tom, with a final admonishing look, disappears into the woods. Ellis cranks the motor and points the boat up river.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER 58
dialogues.text: Edges of the notebook paper flap in the wind. Neckbone re Mud's letter to Juniper. Ellis reaches the bank where they stash their boat. He sh off the motor and let's them drift. Neckbone folds the letter back up and turns to face Ellis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He loves her. You can tell that much. You gonna take it to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him I would. Neckbone thinks about this seriously, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Could be a lot of trouble. 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still got that trailer you made for your bike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neckbone rides with Ellis on the back of his dirt bike. Cars and Trucks HONK and zip by them. Their speed is topp out at about 15 miles per hour. Mostly a result of the sm 3X4 metal trailer they are towing behind the bike. One of Senior's white fish coolers sits in the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parked in the far corner of the lot, Ellis sits on top of white cooler eyeing the Executive Inn. Neckbone straddles the dirt bike. A handful of cars are parked at the motel; old Honda, a pick-up, and a BLACK LINCOLN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say we start at the top, work our way down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. They each grab an end of the cooler and carry it across t lot toward a flight of stairs.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SECOND FLOOR, 61
dialogues.text: The boys set the cooler down in front of the first room o the corner. Ellis checks over his shoulder, nothing stran Ellis knocks. They wait. No answer. They pick the cooler up and walk to the next door. Knock. After a moment, a BLACK MAN in his late sixties opens the door wearing boxers and an undershirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're sellin' fish. You wanna buy some?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fish? He looks at the two boys like they are insane.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don't want no damn fish. 56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slams the door. They drag the cooler to the next door. As Ellis holds up fist to knock, they hear a woman shouting a few doors dow

dialogues.speaker: STOP IT
dialogues.text: Ellis heads for the room. Neckbone drags the cooler after him. Ellis reaches the motel room door, which has been le ajar. He places his hand on it and lets it fall open.

dialogues.speaker: CRACK YOUR NOSE OPEN
dialogues.text: The door opens to CARVER(47), a tall, slender man in a da Western cut suit, standing over Juniper. She's crumpled u in a ball at the end of the bed. Carver swats open-handed her head. Grabs the top of her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear me bitch? Tell me another lie. Ellis rushes Carver with his shoulder as if he were break down a door. Carver is knocked off balance. He trips over the edge of the bed and crashes into the motel room wall. Carver, slightly stunned, gets to his feet and in two bro steps lands a man-sized punch across Ellis' face. It's ha Ellis melts. He grabs the boy up by the scruff of his shi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you!? Who the hell are you!? Did he send you!? Carver removes a piece of paper from his pocket. It's a photo copied picture of Mud, different than the State Trooper's. Carver crams the photo in the boy's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know this man!? Look at him! Do you know him!? Blood trickles from a cut under Ellis' eye. He stutters under the shaking force of Carver's hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't...I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neckbone is yelling at the top of his lungs, almost in a girl's pitch. Carver turns to him. The cooler is open behind them and Neckbone holds up two Ziplock bags of fis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're just selling fish! Carver sizes things up. It takes a moment, but he settles He snorts out a laugh and drops Ellis on the ground. Carver turns his attention back to Juniper, who is huddle in the corner of the motel. Carver walks over to her. Opening a good-sized knife, he gets down in her face and holds the blade uncomfortably close to her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you know where he is. And I swear to God I'll cut through every one a you to find him. She flinches. Standing, Carver folds up his knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know you came here for him, and we know he's too stupid to leave you behind. So when he pops his head out of whatever shithole he's staying in, I'll be there. You tell him that. Carver turns, stepping over Ellis on his way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you need to mind your business boy. Neckbone moves from the doorway to let him pass. Carver i gone. Neckbone shuts the door and fastens the security latch. He kneels down to check on his friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He popped your eye. Ellis holds the back of his hand up to his eye which has begun to swell. The cut trickles blood over his cheekbone Juniper moves to the sink. Ellis sits up, staring at her back. 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens an ice bucket and wraps a handful of cubes in a towel. She turns and walks over to them, her eyes cast do She kneels in front of Ellis, making eye contact for the first time. She touches his chin, gently pivoting it to s the wound. Her eyes are glassy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. He stares back at her. He can't take his eyes off her. Sh holds the iced towel to his cheek. He doesn't even flinch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry. Tears form and run down her cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. She takes his hand and places it against the towel. She g to her feet and pulls a pocket book from a bag in the cor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much is your fish? I'll buy the cooler full. Ellis motions Neckbone to the cooler. Neckbone goes over crams his hand into the ice. He removes a Ziplock bag containing the note that Mud sent. Neckbone hands it to Ellis. Taking the note, he sets his down and walks over to Juniper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud sent us to give this to you. Juniper is stunned. She looks at the bag, then at the boy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've met Mud? Ellis nods. Neckbone speaks up from the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah we met him. Juniper takes the bag. She removes the letter and takes a seat on the edge of the bed to read it. Ellis watches her eyes move along the paper. She smiles, which makes Ellis smile. After a moment, she folds it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tells me to hold tight. 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we read it. Juniper raises her eyebrows at Neckbone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well do you know how long `hold tight' is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's a couple days. He wants to get a boat for ya'll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God. Juniper shakes her head and goes to the sink. She pulls a lighter from her jeans pocket and torches Mud's note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him I'll wait. Running water over the ashes, she turns back to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't want ya'll involved. Tell him what I said and make that it. I don't want you gettin' in any trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you call that? She motions to his swelling eye. Ellis shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be all right. Keep your door locked. We'll be in touch. Ellis heads to the door as Neckbone gathers up the cooler

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Ellis turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Ellis. That's Neckbone. 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juniper walks up to Ellis and puts her hands on his shoulders. She has to bend slightly to do it, but she kis him just above his swollen eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you Ellis. Ellis stares at her, infatuated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta go. Ellis turns and grabs one end of the cooler. Neckbone sla back the security latch and opens the door with his free hand. They walk out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis, his foot on the door, looks back at Juniper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock the door. She smiles. The door slams shut. The room number, 212, stares Ellis in the face. He takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go hard on. He and Ellis wrangle the cooler down the steps. The sun s while they were inside. A blue hue hangs over everything.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. CARVER'S LINCOLN/PIGGLY WIGGLY PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: Carver takes a drag off a cigarette from behind the steer wheel of his black Lincoln town car, conscious to blow an smoke out the open driver's window. His car, wedged between two others in the Piggly Wiggly parking lot, is pointed toward the Executive Inn. He watc as Ellis and Neckbone load the cooler onto Neckbone's bik

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis enters his houseboat. It's quiet. He sees a note on the counter next to a can of soup. It reads, "I've gone to a movie. Warm up some soup for dinne Love, Mom". Ellis picks up the can, not thrilled. He goes to the fridge and grabs a sack of peas from the freezer. Holding the peas against his eye he takes a seat the counter and flips through a phone book. He finds what he needs and dials a corded phone. He waits 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Is May Pearl there?...This is Ellis...Hey, it's Ellis. Hey... What?...In the phone book... from his car commercials...I think they're all right...Tomorrow? Yeah, I can meet you... Okay. Bye. Ellis hangs up the phone. With the peas pressed firmly against his face, he smirks.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF IMAGES
dialogues.text: -Neckbone's sneaker busts through a rotten plank of wood. -Inside a decrepit wooden shack, Ellis gives Neckbone a l like he's a dumbass as they proceed to take the shack apa board by board. Ellis now has a full-on BLACK EYE. A66 -Neckbone stands lookout under the carport section of houseboat. The coast clear, he gives Ellis a nod. Ellis pops open a metal locker and removes a small chainsaw and container of gas. He loads these into an empty fish coole B66 -Tom, sitting atop his houseboat with his pellet gun, as the two boys sneak the tools away. He's displeased. C66 -At Neckbone's mobile home park, Ellis heaves loops o rope onto their mini dirt bike trailer. Neckbone stands nearby laughing with the rope's OWNER, a lanky guy with b teeth and a Tasmanian Devil tattoo on his neck. AC66 -Ellis hoists Neckbone up by the foot allowing him t unscrew a road sign. D66 -A mop soaked in black tar slops across the flat roof furniture store in downtown Dewitt. Neckbone and Ellis st in the store's parking lot yelling up to the ROOFERS. -They get one's attention, and Neckbone points to a dried pile of leftover tar that has been dumped at the back of building. The ROOFER swats a hand at the boys. They proce to load the dried hunk onto the small trailer. E66 -From a distance, Neckbone and Ellis stand on a sailb the middle of a fenced-in marine junkyard. Surrounded by boat parts, the boys begin shuttling several large metal pulleys off the sailboat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud smiles, showing his missing tooth, as he looks over t load of items the boys have stacked in their boat. Neckbo tosses a loop of rope to him. 61A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got more, but no motor. 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This'll work for now. You get her my note?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Ellis turns and Mud sees his black eye for the first time

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get that from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We came up on Juniper's room. A guy was in there beatin' up on her. Mud's face turns dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis rushed him. Got smacked for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd he look like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Tall. Looked like a cowboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark hair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: DAMMIT
dialogues.text: Mud slings the rope to the ground and kicks it. His face flushed. It's the first time the boys have seen him angry

dialogues.speaker: GOD DAMMIT
dialogues.text: The boys back up. Mud takes a deep breath, tries to cool down. It takes a moment, then something occurs to him. He eyes Ellis with a look of genuine gratitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for lookin' after her. Ellis nods. Mud picks up the rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name's Carver. Brother of the man I shot. If he's here, then more are comin'. 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More what? Mud gathers the supplies and heads to the treeline. The boys, with their hands full, follow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bounty hunters. Carver's rotten, but his daddy's the one to be scared of. He'll spend all the money he has to see me dead. If it was up to me I'd put the whole family down same as the other. Not a decent man between `em. Mud stops and turns to lay a serious look on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya'll listen to me now. If you see that old man, don't get near him. He's the triple six real deal scratch you hear me? Mud waits for nods from them both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen drifts in his own boat out on the Mississippi River He stares at something in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: A68 FROM ACROSS THE RIVER, A68
dialogues.text: He sees Neckbone and Ellis on the island walking with Mud Galen, a concerned look on his face, keeps one hand on hi motor and the other on a bulging net of mussel shells. His HELPER, a salty looking man in his fifties, sits at t front of the boat sipping Budweiser from the can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you waitin' for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. After a moment, Galen cranks the motor and speeds away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud stands with Ellis and Neckbone on the deck of the boa He holds a pulley in one hand and a length of rope in the other. He stares up into the trees. 64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis, can you climb up that trunk and get these hung?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a foot of line and tie `em off with a bowline knot. You know it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not stupid. Ellis takes the pulley and scales the trunk without hesitation. Mud tosses his pocket knife to Neckbone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neck, start cuttin' line. Three fifteen foot sections. Count a foot long as your arm. Mud begins threading the pulleys with rope. As Neckbone c rope, he sees the pistol stuck in the back of Mud's pants

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so special `bout that shirt you'd lose your pistol for it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's got a wolf's eye sewn in the sleeve. More protection than a bullet ever gave. Tom swears by it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he wasn't your daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom's the closest thing I ever knew to a father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never met my parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard not knowin' the ones you came from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My uncle Galen tells me things about `em. He's the one that takes care of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom did that for me. 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis drops down to the deck and grabs another pulley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you mean when you called Tom an assassin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom's had lives you'd never know about. Grew up up North. Went to Yale. For a long time he was a paid killer for the C.I.A. Lived in Cuba in `63. He's probably killed more people than you've met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hand me that line. Neckbone tosses him an end of rope, looks to Ellis. Ellis gives a shrug before heading back up the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud hangs off the tree fifteen feet up by a piece of rope tied around his waist. A series of ropes and pulleys crisscross from the boat to the trees. Neckbone and Ellis stand on the ground staring up at him. Mud holds a chainsaw and seems to be hesitating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well if you're gonna do it do it! Mud takes a deep breath and yanks the cord. Angled on one the main branches holding up the boat, Mud begins cutting Ellis and Neckbone step further and further back as they watch the chainsaw work through the thick limb. Suddenly, the chainsaw stops. A deep CRACKING sound. The huge branch SNAPS, tumbling off lower limbs before crashi to the ground. Mud holds onto the trunk for dear life. The branch now rests on the ground, SILENCE. The ropes an pulleys hang taught, squeaking from the weight of the boa Mud slowly lifts his head up. He smiles at what he sees. The rigging has held.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One down! Neckbone and Ellis watch as Mud scampers around the trunk the next branch. The chainsaw cranks back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This shit is crazy. 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis looks out the car window at HIGH SCHOOL KIDS that h gathered in the Piggly Wiggly parking lot. His hair is slicked to one side, and he's wearing a collared shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time are you gonna be home? Ellis shrugs. She looks at him as the car radio rambles.

dialogues.speaker: MARY LEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No later than eleven? Ellis nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You make up your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About moving in town?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About leavin' dad. Mary Lee thinks about how to answer, shuts off the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't make other people change Ellis. If I'm unhappy then I'll have to be the one to change something. Ellis chews on the inside of his cheek and watches her av eye contact. He shoulders his way out of the car. Mary Lee takes a moment before driving off. As Mary Lee pulls away, Ellis takes in the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up at Juniper's motel room and sees her leaning the railing smoking a cigarette. She doesn't see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses, noticing a MAN to his left who ALSO stares up Juniper. The man, early thirties with a thick mustache, i JAMES. He leans against the grill of a black Lincoln. 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carver appears from inside the Piggly Wiggly. He holds a of coffee and is closely trailed by a fat little man, NELSON(56). They're all dressed in a similar fashion, a cross between rural farmers and rodeo stars. As Carver approaches the Lincoln, he scolds James for lea on the grill. Carver rubs the hood with his coat sleeve a gives orders to the men.

dialogues.speaker: MAY PEARL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Ellis! Ellis turns to see May Pearl hopping down from a Ford Bro She leans on the door and waves Ellis into the back.

dialogues.speaker: MAY PEARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on! Ellis takes another look at Carver and his men before run over to the Bronco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bonfire rages in the middle of an open field. A FEW DOZ KIDS mingle between vehicles and the fire. Drinking, yelling, music blasting from car speakers. Ellis stands by himself next to the blaze with his hands his pockets. May Pearl has vanished. Pryor, the skinny kid Ellis punched to get this date, wan past. He makes eye contact. Ellis stares him down. Pryor glares back but then just skulks over to another group.

dialogues.speaker: MAY PEARL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Try this. A Styrofoam Sonic Cup is thrust into Ellis' hand. He turn to find May Pearl standing next to him.

dialogues.speaker: MAY PEARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on. She leads Ellis behind one of the trucks parked nearby. M Pearl climbs onto the tailgate, a red glow across her fac No one else is around. Ellis hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: MAY PEARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You wanna sit down? Ellis takes a seat next to her. She looks at him, smiling and gestures to his black eye.

dialogues.speaker: MAY PEARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You must really like to fight? 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. Ellis takes a sip from the Sonic cup. His face puckers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're not scared if you have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess. You got a lot of friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all right. I don't know all of `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you're pretty popular.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. `Cause you're nice to people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're nice to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I like you. Ellis digs into his jeans pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got this for you. He removes a bracelet made from the pearls he collected o Galen's porch. May Pearl takes it, begins putting it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bracelet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neckbone's uncle caught the pearls. I thought with your name and everything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. She leans over, hugging him with a kiss on the cheek. She stays close. 69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna be my girlfriend? She smiles, then kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning fog sits on top of the water around Ellis' houseb Ellis steps outside and makes his way to the ice machine. loud WHISTLE comes from across the oxbow. Ellis walks to edge of the garage. A75 He sees Tom Blankenship seated on the roof of his hou He motions Ellis over. Ellis watches him, unsure of what to do. Another WHISTLE. Tom motions to him again. Ellis looks back at the house. sign of his parents. He shoots a glance back at Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis bumps his father's boat against the side of Tom's houseboat. He steps up onto the deck and ties off. Tom, down from the roof, stands by his front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want some coffee? Tom disappears inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't drink coffee. Ellis waits for a moment, but realizes this is Tom's way inviting him inside. He enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This houseboat, although similar in size, is different th Ellis'. It's an actual wood shack that has been construct atop a barge. Ellis looks at photos, books and memorabilia that cram th walls and shelves. It feels homey. Tom, his back to the boy, stands in the kitchen area pour a cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been seein' Mud?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A collection of framed photos on a desk catches Ellis' attention. A young Tom with a pretty dark skinned girl. They seem happy. Another photo, late 60's, of Tom standin alone in a suit. He holds a LONG SUITCASE. Tom enters holding two cups of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to lie to me boy. He hands Ellis a cup of coffee with a cartoon image of a on it. It reads, "I'm a real bitch in the morning!" Tom sits in a LazyBoy that he gently rocks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen you runnin' around. Takin' things. He all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He get that boat down? Ellis nods. There is an awkward moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He called you an assassin. Tom snorts out a laugh, sips his coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you known Mud?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Few days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's long enough to know he's full of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's not true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was a sharpshooter in the army. In Mud's world, that makes me an assassin. Not exactly true, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah I guess. Tom notices the boy's disappointment. 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he's a bad ass don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know why he's stuck out on that island?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shot somebody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tell you why he shot that man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he hurt Juniper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. The real reason Mud's in the trouble he's got is because of her. He's been in love with that girl since he was your age. They used to run all around here and it was the same back then. He'd follow that girl wherever she led him. Problem is she don't care about nobody but herself. I've told him as much. She'd bed down with the meanest snake she could find, then when things went bad she'd go runnin' to Mud. Mud would take her back, then go find whatever unlucky sonofabitch last put a hand on her and beat `em `til they knew to never touch her again. And this time I guess he thought a beating wasn't good enough. Had to shoot that fella. I don't know for sure, but I'd put money on Juniper knowin' he'd do it. And I have a suspicion she might of even told him to. Either way, those two are set for failure. Only chance Mud has is to cut her loose. Cause I'll tell you what, Mud's no bad ass. He's runnin' scared. Ellis can't look Tom in the eye, he's offended by the old man's remarks. Ellis sets the coffee cup on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go. Ellis heads for the door, but stops short. 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong about Juniper. They love each other and they're gonna make it. If you weren't a wore out old man you'd know it was true. Tom eyes the boy, taking a sip from his cup. He nods a goodbye to Ellis who is already out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis stomps out of the trees and is struck by the new position of the boat. It hangs three feet off the ground; SUSPENDED in dry dock. A clear-cut path of trees leads of toward the island's southern shore. Beside the boat, remnants of a giant fire smolder. Ellis surveys the MOUND OF ASH.

dialogues.speaker: MUD, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: What you say Ellis? Ellis turns to find Mud standing on the deck of the boat holding a fistful of wires. He jumps down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got more stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You find a motor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. (points to the ash) What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made a bonfire. Mud enters the woods. Ellis follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bonfire's an all purpose cure all for bad luck. I don't know where this boat's been or what kind of person had it before me. For all I know it could have some serious bad business left on it. We got too much ridin' on this thing to leave to chance. Where's Neckbone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helpin' his uncle with a dive. 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud and Ellis exit the treeline heading to Ellis' boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom called me over to his place this mornin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was runnin' down Juniper. Ellis looks for a response, but Mud just jumps up into th boat and starts throwing pieces of wood on shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him he was a wore out old man. Told him he couldn't know how much you loved Juniper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know his story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should. Tom loved a woman more than most men could in two lifetimes. They had a good life started together. Mud hops down and scoops a load of wood into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was pregnant with a little boy, but the birth got the better of `em. They didn't make it. Tom's been alone ever since. Lone wolf. Mud has begun walking back to the treeline. Ellis stays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go help my dad. Mud turns back but doesn't stop moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the wood Ellis. Ellis watches him go, thinking on what he said. 74.

dialogues.speaker: RIVER
dialogues.text: Fully suited in diving gear, Galen toils in the murky bro water at the bottom of the river. His gear consists of a typical wet-suit, wet-socks but no gloves. His metal helmet is not typical. It's welded from half a hot water heater that's been fitted with barbell weights. A hose connected to the top runs to the surface. Galen ties off a netted sack and yanks on its line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small air compressor chugs as Neckbone stands in the mi of Galen's boat pulling in the heavy rope. At the end, th net bulging with mussel shells appears. He manages to roll the heavy load into the boat before mo over to a crank handle that feeds another line. After several cranks, Galen's steel helmet breaches the surface. He places his hands on the edge of the boat as Neckbone removes the barbell weights. The weight removed, Neckbone takes off the helmet. Galen pulls himself into the boat, out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This shit never gets easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a good haul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had worse. Galen reclines as Neckbone kills the air compressor and begins organizing the gear. He watches his little nephew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You doin' all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need to tell me anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I'm just your uncle, not much of a parent. But you can tell me things if you need to. 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can tell you this helmet smells like my duck butter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis holds a wrought iron door open with his backside as ELDERLY WOMAN takes the paper bag of fish from his hands. Ellis walks back to the truck. Senior watches him, lookin at the black eye.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. SENIOR'S TRUCK/CATFISH PARLOUR
dialogues.text: Ellis rides up front with Senior. Windows down, no radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get that black eye?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A kid in town. He got his too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you fightin' for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Bout a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When'd that happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other day. Senior pats his shirt pocket and finds a smoke. Lights it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seen your mother today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You not talkin' to me? 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talkin'. I'm talkin' to both of you. That's all ya'll want to do is talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's your mother. Would rather tongue lash a problem than step up and handle it. You'll see one day. Women are tough. They'll set you up for things. You can't trust love, Ellis. If you're not careful, it'll run out on you. You just gotta pick a woman and roll the dice. Hope you don't wake up in fifteen years hatin' each other. Ellis keeps staring out the window as they pull into the parking lot of the Catfish Parlour Restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senior climbs out of the truck and enters the restaurant. Ellis pops open the tailgate and reaches for a cooler. The Catfish Parlour is one business in a strip center row There is nothing else around save for farmland and a mote across the road. Ellis notices Carver's black LINCOLN parked in the motel He walks away from the truck to get a better look. Ellis scans the FOUR OTHER VEHICLES in the lot. All Texas plates. A maroon Cadillac sails past and turns into the motel. Ellis recedes to the rear of his truck. He watches as KING(76), a fireplug of a man, emerges from Cadillac. Cramped from a long drive, he stretches and eye the sign for the Pines Motel. A motel room door opens and Carver walks out. He's smilin and calls out to King. They hug as a green PICK-UP pulls MILLER, a slick dressed man in black boots, climbs out.

dialogues.speaker: SENIOR, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Ellis! Let's go! Ellis snaps around to find Senior leaning out the restaur door. Ellis yanks the cooler down and drags it inside. He looks back over his shoulder for a final glance at the me

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy this is Miller. He's one of ours. 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you do? Appreciate your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be in in a minute. Miller nods and enters the motel room. King turns to Carv

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catch me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They work in shifts. Two outside her motel, the others either out searching or sleepin' here. I met with the county sheriff but he wasn't much help. Said they'd handle their own business, but I got two of their people on payroll and a person on the inside at the state police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Doin' good. Who all's here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All but two now. Nelson and James are watchin' her place. I called the rest in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Let's meet the men. Carver leads his father to the motel room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carver holds the door open as King steps inside. A door t his left connects another room which is empty. An episode of the Smurfs plays on the television. There's MAN on each of the queen beds. Another THREE playing card at a small table by the window. MILLER stands in the corn smoking. Empty Budweiser cans litter the room. King, unimpressed by the scene, looks at his son. Carver quickly moves in front of the television and turns it off He stares down the men on the beds. 78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up. (to the others) Ya'll pay attention. The men get up from the beds and the others put down thei cards. Everyone slowly gathers into an audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my father, King. He runs the show. Carver recedes as King steps forward. He speaks like a hi school football coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men. I wanna thank you for the work you're doin'. It's important work, and I want you to know what it means to me personally. I'm grateful for it. No man should have to bury his son. It's not natural, and it's a pain I hope none of you ever have to endure. King removes a photocopied picture of Mud from his pocket He unfolds it, stares at it, then raises it to the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man did that to me. He took my youngest boy. And now, you're gonna help me get him. King stares at the men, keeping the photo held high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now gather `round. Come on now, in a circle. I want ya'll to join hands. They do it reluctantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody take a knee. They do. King joins them on his knee and grabs Carver and another Man's hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bow your heads. I need you to help me pray for the death of the man that killed my son. They all bow their heads. 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tarp is thrown back from a rusting boat trailer. Ellis and Neckbone stand by the trailer looking less than thrilled. It's covered in junk and debris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You touch her breast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Ellis walks up and knocks a stack of bricks off the trail

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could take it apart. Bring it out piece by piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's welded. We'd just tear it up. What if we float it out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Neckbone walks to the trailer. Ellis follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys open the front door and are met by a BLINDING LI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus! They squint and shield their eyes. The light shuts off as quickly as it came on. Galen stand in front of them wearing his wet suit. The bar with the flood lights attached sits across his shoulders. The boys rub their eyeballs, seeing spots. Galen shuffles over to the couch holding a marine battery connected to t lights. He labors to take a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think? 79A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's real good Galen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme a minute. Neckbone, still blinking, goes back to his room. Ellis notices Galen staring at him. Galen pats the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come `ere Ellis. Ellis takes a seat on the other end of the couch. Galen p the spot next to him. Ellis scoots over, uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see that ceiling fan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found it in the river. Works great. Best ceiling fan I've ever owned. This river brings a lotta trash down it. Some a that trash is worth a lotta money, some of it's not. You gotta know what's worth keepin' and what's worth lettin' go. You know the difference?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neck looks up to you. Don't get my nephew into anything you can't get him out of. Galen forces a stare with Ellis, who nods. Neckbone enter as Galen begins to remove his light rig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help Me Rhonda's just about a guy needing to get a piece to get over a girl that put one over on him. So you get your heart broke, don't walk around with a shit look on your face. Get back in there. Get your tip wet. You hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I'm sayin'. 79B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis doesn't. Galen moves to an electric guitar leaning a small amp in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya'll wanna hang out? Alan's comin' over. We're gonna pump it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got stuff to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever. The boys exit as Galen turns on the amp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen pumps it up inside as Neckbone and Ellis walk to th boat trailer. Neckbone pulls a handful of long zip ties f his back pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were ya'll talkin' about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud's knife slices through a plastic zip tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: King. That's what they call him. A BOAT TRAILER rests atop FOUR, 55-GALLON BRIGHT YELLOW BARRELS affixed with plastic zip ties. The make-shift raf is half on shore with the back still floating in the wate The boys watch as Mud walks around the trailer cutting of the zip ties. The barrels kick out from underneath the trailer as this happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's their father. You didn't go near him did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. That left-handed sonofabitch is the devil himself. If he's here, then it's time. We need to get Juniper out here. 79C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We still need a motor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a motor in the scrap yard might work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need one that runs. Mud moves to the front of the boat trailer and begins dragging it fully onto the bank. It's heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can get it runnin'. Tell him Ellis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true. He built his own dirt bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right then. Give it a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. That motor's worth somethin'. It's not like this other junk. 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been there for months. Nobody's even gonna know it's gone. Ellis hesitates. He looks to Mud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do need a motor. Ellis thinks on it as Mud takes a deep breath and grabs t trailer again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The supermarket is busy. Ellis stands at a pay phone out front as Neckbone kicks a vending machine nearby. Ellis looks at Juniper's motel. He scans the Piggly Wiggl parking lot and spots Carver's black Lincoln. Ellis picks the phone and deposits some change. He dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna talk to room 212.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. JUNIPER'S MOTEL ROOM/PIGGLY WIGGLY
dialogues.text: Juniper watches TV (o.s) at the foot of the bed. The phon rings. She snaps up, hits mute and grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juniper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank god. I've been goin' crazy in this room. Is Mud okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's time to take you out to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow. We'll come get you. 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's goin' on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got a plan for ya'll to get away. Be ready tomorrow at five. Neckbone'll be waitin' at the back of the motel with a dirt bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're watching my room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take care of that. Just be ready at five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Just wait. I don't know about alla this. I don't even know what he thinks we're gonna do. Where are we even gonna go? This is Mud. This is what Mud does. Ellis hears her crying through the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. He's got the boat. We helped him fix it up. It's a good plan. Just be ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you even doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you helping us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause ya'll love each other. Juniper searches for a comment. Ellis, looking out over the parking lot, sees May Pearl getting out of a car with her MOTHER and SISTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Dial Tone. Juniper holds the phone, worried. 82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis turns and watches May Pearl push a cart in the park lot with her family. Neckbone bangs at the Coke machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd it go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're good.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. CARVER'S LINCOLN/PIGGLY WIGGLY PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: Carver sits behind the wheel of his Lincoln. The man with the mustache, James, sits in the passenger seat next to h Carver notices Ellis and Neckbone standing in front of th Piggly Wiggly. He climbs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme a quarter. This shit took mine. Ellis watches May Pearl entering the grocery store. He ca out with a wave.

dialogues.speaker: MAY PEARL
dialogues.text: Without stopping, May Pearl, along with her Sister and Mother, all turn. May Pearl sees him, but doesn't wave ba She continues inside. Ellis looks confused, then embarrassed. Neckbone notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right man. She's with her family. Come on. I wanna get that motor before dark. They head to the dirt bike.

dialogues.speaker: CARVER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey there! Ellis turns to see Carver approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember me don't you? Ellis nods. Carver notes the healing bruise on Ellis' fac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure sorry about that. Ya'll caught me at a real bad time. 83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis climbs on the bike. Carver walks over to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on now. One second. I don't want ya'll thinkin' I'm a bad guy. Ya'll were just trying to do a job, and I got in your way. Carver removes a roll of twenties and peels off two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just say I bought that whole batch of fish ya'll were sellin'. Would forty cover it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'd bout do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't want your money. Carver steps in close to the boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet ya'll really get around this town. Probably know every hole and ditch. Have ya'll come across the man whose picture I showed you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Carver removes a flier with Mud's picture and holds it ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure about that? Take a look with your good eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about that girl in the motel? The pretty one. Ya'll talk to her some more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Carver smiles. He tucks the flier and the forty dollars i Ellis' hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a number on there. Ya'll let me know if you do. 84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neckbone cranks the engine and backs the bike up with his feet. They pull away. Moving, Ellis looks back to see Carver watching them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neckbone pulls back a loose section of chain-link fence surrounding the marine junkyard. Ellis crouches through.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE JUNKYARD,
dialogues.text: Ellis and Neckbone creep through piles of starboard and b parts. They stop at a party barge with only one pontoon. its rear hangs a big rusted motor, 200 horsepower. Neckbone quickly disassembles its attachment. The motor p loose leaving the boys to strain against its heavy weight They ease it to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus that's heavy. The boys get on either side of the motor and begin half- dragging it back to the fence line.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE YARD,
dialogues.text: A LITTLE GIRL(10) dangles her feet off a loading platform bites at an ice cream sandwich. She watches Neckbone and Ellis from a distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis walks onto the houseboat as the sound of Neckbone's bike fades in the trees. He stops, noticing a PAPER BAG sitting on the water's edge of the boat. He goes over to He opens the sack and takes a quick inventory. A loaf of bread, potted meats, a bottle of Jack Daniels, a roll of cash, and an Arkansas boat tag. Ellis looks around, no one. He looks over to Tom's boat. It's dark. Ellis scoops up the sack and heads inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The digital wristwatch changes from "4:59" to "5:00". Neckbone sits on his bike parked near the vending machine the Piggly Wiggly. Ellis, on the payphone, scans the park lot. No sign of Carver's Lincoln. No other Bounty Hunters

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are those bastards? 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not answerin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you wanna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your bike around the side. I'll check her room. We'll just have to hope no one sees us. Neckbone cranks the bike and speeds toward the motel. Ell looks to the motel, then the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SECOND FLOOR,
dialogues.text: Ellis cautiously heads up the stairs. He eyes the parking lot at the Piggly Wiggly but still sees no sign of Carver men. He moves quickly toward Juniper's door. Checking over his shoulder, he knocks. No answer. He knocks again. Nothing. He peeks through the window. No lights. No movement.

dialogues.speaker: BY THE DIRT BIKE, 95
dialogues.text: Neckbone gets off his bike and slips to the corner of the building. As he peeks his head out, Ellis nearly knocks h over on his way downstairs. They both flinch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Was she there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin'. Ellis notices the front office

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MOTEL CLERK(29) doesn't look up from his issue of Lowrider as Ellis and Neckbone enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scuse me, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're lookin' for the girl in room 212. You seen her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see her today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she came down askin' for directions to the nearest bar. I told her to head out to a place on 61. Ellis digests this. They turn to leave.

dialogues.speaker: MOTEL CLERK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait a second, are ya'll the little bastards tryin' to sell fish to the guests? They're already out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis and Neckbone pull into the gravel lot in front of a roadside bar. The cinder block building sits by itself ju off the highway. Cars and motorcycles fill the lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think this is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gotta be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The small bar is loud and crowded. Shoulder to shoulder PATRONS bump against one another as MUSIC blares. Neckbone and Ellis press through the crowd searching for Juniper. They are a good foot shorter than anyone else. Ellis notices a man at the bar. It's Miller, the bounty hunter from King's motel. He's staring at something acros the room. Ellis follows his line of sight. The crowd weaves in front of him, but then he sees her. Juniper leans against a pool table at the far end of the A GUY(32) whispers in her ear and kisses her neck. She throws her head back, laughing. Ellis watches in disbelie Nearby, the BARTENDER(46) fills a customer's shot glass. two underage kids catch his attention. 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis' face is frozen, locked on Juniper. Neckbone places hand on his shoulder. Juniper's eyes drift toward the boys. She makes eye conta with Ellis, and her smile vanishes. The Guy keeps whisper in her ear. Juniper straightens her back slightly. Ellis can't take his eyes off her. Juniper stares back at him, but doesn't make a move. After a moment, Juniper's eyes fall to the floor. She tur her head back to the Guy. The crowd fills back in and the image is out of Ellis' reach.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: What the hell are ya'll doin'?! The Bartender swoops in, grabbing them both by the backs their necks and shoving them toward the door. Ellis strai against the thick hand. He tries to get another look at Juniper, but it's too crowded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bartender flings Ellis and Neckbone into the parking Neckbone slides on the loose gravel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya'll stay outta here! Ellis just stands staring at the front door. The Bartende makes a swatting motion toward them.

dialogues.speaker: I SAID GET OUTTA HERE
dialogues.text: Neckbone gathers his friend and leads him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on man. They head over to Neckbone's dirt bike. He pulls out the and climbs on. Ellis hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take you home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna have to tell Mud. Neckbone drops his head, nods reluctantly. 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys struggle to pull the heavy motor out of their bo It hits the shoreline with a thud. They lean over it, sucking air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just leave it. Mud'll have to help get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you gonna tell him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll just tell him the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud stands at the back of the boat, which now rests on th boat trailer near the water. His face is clean shaven and his hair is wetted back. His shirt, still filthy, is tuck into his pants. He whistles and works by the light of a small fire nearby Ellis steps out from behind a tree. He's holding the groc sack that was left on his houseboat.

dialogues.speaker: MUD
dialogues.text: Mud, hearing the voice, quickly puts down his tools and t to the woods. He smooths his clothes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you say there?! Ellis appears out of the dark, followed by Neckbone. Mud' eyes search the treeline for Juniper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you say Ellis? Ellis can't look him in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got that motor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Juniper okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she? 89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't meet up with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? Was it Carver?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't Carver. Mud straightens up, prepares for the news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's goin' on Ellis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was supposed to meet us on the side of the motel. She never showed up. We went asking for her. The motel clerk told us she went to a bar out on 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We tracked her down. She was there with another guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were together. Mud's face drops. He walks to the fire and shakes a cooki pot resting in the coals. The pot bubbles with roof tar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She probably thought Carver was on to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knew the plan Mud. She just didn't show up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was she doin' with the other guy? Ellis hesitates, not wanting to say. Mud pushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were they doin' Ellis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were playin' pool. Drinkin'. He was close up on her. They were laughin'. He kissed her on the neck. Mud nods. 90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's how it is. He takes the pot of roofing tar over to the boat and begi pasting some of the newly replaced boards with a flat sti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want us to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just go home Ellis. Ellis looks at Neckbone, then sets the grocery sack on th ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom left this for you. They slowly retreat into the woods and disappear. Mud turns back to the campfire and shoves the pot into th ashes. His eyes, soft and red, reflect the flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis and Neckbone motor away from the island in the flat bottom boat. They look back at the shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think it's all right to leave him alone?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt it! Neckbone sees Ellis' concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll sleep over at your house tonight! We can check on him first thing tomorrow! Ellis nods. As they head further up river, the island gro smaller, silhouetted by the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neckbone snores, sprawled out on top of a sleeping bag on floor. Ellis sits up in bed with something on his mind. He gets up and steps gingerly over Neckbone to exit the r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is silent. Ellis slips into the kitchen and pic up the phone receiver mounted on the cabinet. 91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls the cord out to stand with his face in the corne He dials, waits, and speaks softly into the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Is May Pearl there...This is Ellis...I called yesterday, you give her my message?...My name is Ellis. I'm her boyfriend...Oh, she's asleep...I said she's asleep? The front door flies open. Senior storms headlong toward Ellis. He shouts.

dialogues.speaker: MARY LEE
dialogues.text: Ellis turns as Senior yanks the phone by the cord. It sna out of Ellis' hand and smashes apart on the floor. Ellis flinches at the sight of his father flying at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell have you been doing?

dialogues.speaker: WHAT HAVE YOU BEEN DOIN'
dialogues.text: Senior grabs Ellis by the arms and shoves him against the wall. Mary Lee comes running from her room.

dialogues.speaker: SENIOR
dialogues.text: She slaps at her husband's arms and back. He swats her aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell her. You tell her what you've been up to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're sayin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your hands off him Senior! Senior keeps Ellis pinned to the wall with his left hand. opens up and addresses Mary Lee with his right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.J. Crawford said a boat motor went missin' from his stock yard. Said his daughter saw this one and his friend haulin' it off. This makes Mary Lee pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you tell me right now, did you steal that motor? 92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't steal it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lie to me again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We thought it was junk. We didn't think it was worth anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis? A cool anger rushes over Senior's face. He releases Ellis and takes a step back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell me I raised a thief?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a thief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take property that's not yours. Property that belongs to another man. That junk is his livelihood. I'm ashamed of you. Ellis drops his head. His face flushed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mary Lee) Shut your mouth. You think you can take things and not have him see it? Neither one of you has any respect for a man's livelihood. A life that puts clothes on your back and food in your stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you blame this on me. One doesn't have a thing to do with the other and you know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me what I know. If you can steal a man's life out from under him in front of your son and think he won't take a lesson from it than you're even dumber than you look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it dad. 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senior volleys a finger at Ellis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's raisin' you a snake like herself, and you can curl up with her `fore I give a damn. You just remember this when you watch them rip this house apart board by board. You Hear Me! Mary Lee slaps Senior hard. He turns to her, saying nothi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a man who's never had the strength to support his own life. I never asked you for a thing, and I've never took a thing from you that I couldn't provide for on my own. If they do tear my home apart the only joy I'll have in my heart is knowin' that they'll be tearing you out of my life for good. She wipes her eyes and turns her attention to Ellis.

dialogues.speaker: MARY LEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ellis. You'll return that motor from where you found it and you'll apologize in person to the man you took it from. I won't hear about anything like this again. Mary Lee walks to the front door. She collects her purse keys and exits quietly. Senior and Ellis stand in silence, which feels even more uncomfortable than the shouting. Ellis finally speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't take that motor back. But I'll pay him for it. I'll pay him what he wants for it. Senior, stoic, pivots his body away from the boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care what you do Ellis. Senior retreats to the bedroom. Ellis is left alone in th wake. He looks to his room. The door opens slightly and Neckbon takes a step out. Neckbone doesn't say anything. He just bites at his lip, sympathy for his friend. 94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charred hunks of driftwood smolder in a ruined pile on th sand. They constitute the remains of a large bonfire. Neckbone and Ellis stare at the ash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a bonfire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess he didn't care about bein' seen. Ellis kicks at one of the burned logs. He bends down and finds the bottle of Jack Daniels, smashed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had something else on his mind. Come on. Ellis leads Neckbone into the treeline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud's yellow shirt hangs, partially ripped, from a tree branch. Ellis pulls it off the limb. Concerned, they head deeper into the woods, over the fall tree trunk that bridges the creek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys watch Mud through the trees at a distance. He's crouched on the deck of the boat fiddling with wiring. Mu giving no sign he sees the boys, yells out to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are ya'll hidin' for? Mud drops the wiring and scales down to the bank. They emerge from the woods. Ellis carries the yellow shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found your shirt. Ellis tosses it to him. Mud tosses it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it. I don't need it anymore. Mud goes to the motor at the rear to tinker with more wir 95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We saw what's left of your bonfire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody could've seen you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do some drinkin' last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did a lot of drinkin' last night. Mud stops and walks over to address the boys. His face is pale and his manner is curt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neck I'm gonna need you here to get the motor runnin'. Ellis I need you to do something else for me. Mud removes a folded note from his back pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to take this to Juniper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay Mud. Ellis takes the letter. Mud goes back to the boat motor. motions to Neckbone to join him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still takin' Juniper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a dream last night. I saw Juniper laying in a field with another man. They were making love. I walked out into the field. Walked toward `em. I was so angry the tips of my ears were burnin'. That's how I knew I was gonna kill this man. But when I got up close enough, I saw that the man she was with had tattoos on his back, just like mine. I moved in closer and the guy turns his head back toward me. Hair for hair, dead truth, the guy she was with was me. Mud ducks back under the motor. Ellis looks at Neckbone, worried. 96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll finish the boat, but I'd be surprised if I live long enough to sail on it. A vision of yourself is a sure sign of death. Neck can you grab me a socket wrench? Neckbone and Ellis walk to the toolbox sitting nearby. Th crouch by it, speaking quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You be all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I borrow your bike? Neckbone fishes the key out of his pocket. Hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tump it. Ellis nods. Neckbone walks over to Mud with the toolbox. Letter in hand, Ellis gives a final look toward Mud's lab and walks back into the woods. On his way, he stops to ha Mud's shirt on a tree branch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis rides in the flat bottom boat alone. He stares at t letter in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis sits on the dirt bike. He scans the parking lot. No black Lincoln. His eyes stop on a green pick-up. Miller, sits inside. Ellis looks around and finds a pay phone nearby. He gets the bike and walks toward it. Ellis removes the flier Car gave him. He dials a phone number copied at the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Hello. I saw the guy you're lookin' for...Yeah, he's crazy lookin'. Saw him at the Wal-mart outside of Gillet. He was buyin' some beanie weenie...'bout five minutes ago. 97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis hangs up the phone. He walks back over to the bike, climbs on and waits. After a moment, he watches as Miller's green pick-up pull out of the Piggly Wiggly parking lot and races away. Elli cranks the bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis, at a slight crouch, keeps his eyes on the Piggly Wiggly parking lot. The green pick-up is nowhere in sight At Juniper's door, he knocks twice, softly. The door swin opens. Juniper stands there, holding a lit cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wonderin' when I'd see you. Ellis checks over his shoulder and walks inside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bed is unmade and the room is a bit of a mess. Ellis keeps his head down. Juniper closes the door and takes a seat on the edge of the bed. She grabs the remote control and mutes the television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about last night. I didn't plan on... Before she can finish Ellis has fished the letter out of pocket and holds it out to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm supposed to give this to you. Juniper takes the letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Ellis goes to the door. He pulls the bedroom curtain back slightly to check the parking lot. The coast is clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you read it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis? He turns to her. 98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you had to do was be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why'd you even come here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came here to leave with him. I really did. But now...now I guess I just came to say goodbye. His eyes fall to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know us Ellis. We've been headin' this way for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know he'd do anything for you. She puts her cigarette out in a Coke can on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really believe that? Ellis nods. Juniper speaks to him gently, almost smiling. It's a look of resignation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud's a born liar. That's what makes him so likable. He makes people feel good about themselves. He's a romantic. I don't think he means to hurt people. But when people get close to him, that's what happens. Ellis watches her as she goes to the sink and wets the en a towel. She dabs her eyes at the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do love him Ellis. But I can't spend the rest of my life runnin' with him. I may not know what kind of life I want, but I know that's not it. Her back to him, Ellis watches as she unfolds the letter begins reading. He angles himself to see her face in the mirror. He watches her eyes scanning the words. No emotio 99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finishes, folds the letter back up, then turns to him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It says it's over. Tell him I've packed my things. Tell him I've gone. She takes a deep breath and smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye Ellis. Ellis turns and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis, dejected, no longer bothers to look over his shoul He walks to the staircase but stops there. Feeling the ne to say something more, he goes back to her room. He puts his knuckle flat on the door but hesitates. He le over and looks through the window. The sliver in the curtain gives him a glimpse. Juniper is curled up on the end of the bed. She is sobbing. Ellis watches longer than he should before pulling his he away from the window. Ellis heads back downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis, riding the dirtbike, looks to his left into the So Drive-In parking lot. The high school kids have gathered there again. He notices a rust colored Ford coup. The driver, an older kid named KYLE(18), sits beside May Pearl laughing. Ellis steers into traffic and crosses the street. He pull onto a patch of grass at the edge of the Sonic parking lo In one motion, Ellis tumps the bike on its side and makes line for the coup.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CAR,
dialogues.text: Kyle's hand is on May Pearl's knee. 100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what'd she say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said she didn't like him that much. I told her I thought he was all right. Ellis appears with his elbows in the driver's side window He sticks his head so far in the door that Kyle has to le back in his seat to make room. May Pearl is surprised. Ky snorts out a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get my phone calls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been callin' you. (motions with his head) Who's this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your head outta my car kid. Ellis takes his right elbow and quickly knocks Kyle in th mouth. It splits his upper lip. Kyle grabs his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called you twice yesterday. Your sister didn't tell you? Kyle slings the door open knocking Ellis to the pavement. From the ground, Ellis can see that Kyle is big and considerably tougher than the skinny kid he punched befor Kyle's friends from other cars take notice and begin to converge on them. Ellis makes a move for Kyle's legs but is kicked back to pavement. Kyle straddles him on the ground and punches hi Another punch to Ellis' face. May Pearl is out of the car and yelling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle! Stop it Kyle! 101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May Pearl pulls Kyle by the collar. By his own will, he raises off of Ellis, keeping an eye on him. A streak of blood stretches from Ellis' nose to his ear. gets to his feet, dazed. Ellis wipes at his nose and sees May Pearl shove Kyle. Ky smiles and turns to his friends, who laugh. The CROWD tha has collected consists of older high school guys and girl Ellis steps toward May Pearl and is met with a shove too.

dialogues.speaker: MAY PEARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doin' here Ellis?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't just run up and punch people I'm with!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I just wanted to know why you hadn't called me back. I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I call you back Ellis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're my girlfriend. The crowd is watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not your girlfriend! We went on one date. One!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We kissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't matter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what Ellis?! What did you expect?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. 102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fourteen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't. Wait. We can make this work. We can figure it out. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Ellis is losing it. His eyes are red. He looks at the cro of kids. There are smiles and some snickering. May Pearl speechless. She just stares at him. Ellis turns and walks back to the dirt bike. May Pearl's girlfriends gather around her. She shakes her head, dumbstruck. Ellis lifts the bike off the ground. He looks back at May Pearl who appears to be shrugging off the whole affair in front of her friends. Ellis speeds off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fire snaps and pops on the riverbank next to Ellis' houseboat. Ellis drags a piece of particle board from a trash pile nearby. He drops the board onto the fire and stands back watch the blaze. Neckbone's bike leans on a tree behind h Senior's truck rattles to a stop in the gravel just down bank. He jumps out of the cab exasperated by the fire his son has started by their home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doin'?! Ellis says nothing. He doesn't move. Senior, continuing t yell, runs and drags a hose up from the houseboat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis dammit! What the hell's wrong with you?! The fire hisses as Senior turns the hose on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis? Look at me. Ellis finally looks up at his father. A phone RINGS from inside the houseboat. Senior holds the hose in front of h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it. Put this damn thing out. 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
