dialogues.text: Ellis takes the hose as Senior stomps on board to catch t phone. Ellis drops the hose. Senior's voice, speaking into the telephone, faintly carr outside. He's yelling. Ellis turns his head to listen.

dialogues.speaker: SENIOR, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I don't give a shit! Fine! I don't care what you do! I'm done with it! Ellis moves around the fire so he can see the houseboat through the flames. He hears the phone SLAM down. Senior appears at the back door. He stares at Ellis throu the fire. Ellis moves to the side but realizes Senior isn staring at him. He's staring at the fire. Senior disappears back into the house. There is a commoti Ellis watches as Senior bursts out of the house holding a armful of woman's clothes. Senior walks up to the bonfire and begins tossing clothes on top piece by piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Ellis watches as dresses and blouses begin to shrivel up the flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it! That's mom's stuff! STOP

dialogues.speaker: IT
dialogues.text: Ellis shoves at Senior. He easily counters the boy with h arm and continues tossing the clothes into the fire. Elli is screaming and crying.

dialogues.speaker: STOP IT
dialogues.text: Ellis tries yanking the remaining clothes out of his fath hands but Senior shakes him off. Ellis stumbles. He watch with tears as Senior tosses all of the clothes on. Senior watches his wife's clothes burn. Ellis backs away the bike. He climbs on, cranks the engine and speeds off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis grounds the flat-bottom on shore and jumps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis thrashes through the woods. His muddy feet stomp across the fallen tree trunk that bridges the creek. 104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat rests on its trailer on the edge of the bank. Mu stands on board looking down at the motor. Neckbone, tool in hand, has his head buried in the motor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try it now. Mud turns a switch. No result.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonofabitch. Ellis emerges from the treeline. Mud sees him and hops do from the boat. He walks up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd she... Ellis punches Mud with as much force as he can muster. It barely enough to turn Mud's face, but it stuns him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a liar. Makin' two kids run around doin' work you're too scared to do yourself. Makin' me tell her it's over `cause you're too scared to do it yourself. Mud steps back and gives the boy his space. Neckbone has made his way over and watches from behind Mud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you loved her and you lied. You gave up on her and she gave up on you just like everybody else. I trusted you. Bonfires and crosses. Wolf's eye bullshit. Mud tries to approach him but the boy explodes, shoving h

dialogues.speaker: EVERYTHING YOU'VE TOLD ME WAS A
dialogues.text: LIE! You never cared about her. You never cared about us. Not like you said. Not enough to matter. You used us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Ellis. Mud holds a hand out to him. Ellis slaps it away. 105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made me a thief! Ellis walks back into the woods. Mud exhales and turns ba to Neckbone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis walks through the woods. Neckbone follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis! Ellis, stop for a second! Neckbone watches as Ellis reaches the tree trunk that bri the creek. Ellis steps onto the log, but his muddy shoes miss a step. He SLIPS. Neckbone sees Ellis disappear down into the creek bed.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIS
dialogues.text: Neckbone rushes over. He cranes his neck out to peer over the edge, a solid eight foot drop into the creek. Ellis floats face up in the shallow water. He's unconscio A wound on his head from a nearby rock. The nest of WATER MOCCASINS has been disturbed; SNAKES WR AROUND ELLIS' BODY. Neckbone's eyes widen. He darts back toward the shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud stands at the rear of the boat massaging his jaw.

dialogues.speaker: MUD
dialogues.text: Mud hears the yelling. Neckbone explodes from the trees.

dialogues.speaker: CREEK
dialogues.text: Mud rushes forward.

dialogues.speaker: HE FELL INTO SNAKES
dialogues.text: Mud stops. 106.

dialogues.speaker: MUD PLEASE
dialogues.text: Mud looks around. His shirt hangs from a tree limb nearby He snags it and darts into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud streaks through the woods as he gets his other arm through the shirt sleeve. He reaches the creek. Without hesitating, Mud leaps down into the water, scoops Ellis into his arms and scales up the opposite side of th creek bed. Mud sprints for the north side of the island. Neckbone chases after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud cradles Ellis in his arms as he rushes to the flat-bo boat. He sets Ellis gently inside. Neckbone on his heels. Mud shoves the boat into the water and hops in. Neckbone wades out and crawls up the side of the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the motor started. Neckbone cranks the motor. As they move up river, Mud searches Ellis' body. He looks at his neck, his arms, he pulls up his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IS HE OKAY?! Is he bit?! Mud notices Ellis' jeans leg riding up. He pulls the jean back. A BITE in the middle of his calf. It's a bluish bruise with two distinct red dots. The skin around the bi has already begun to swell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. He rips the jeans up to the thigh. Mud tears a section of cloth from the bottom of his own shirt and creates a tourniquet just below Ellis' knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it? Mud pulls a black Sharpie out of his pocket. Neckbone doesn't answer, just stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neckbone checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's four eighteen! Mud draws a line on Ellis' leg just above the swollen bit He writes, "418".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yell out every 10 minutes! Mud elevates Ellis' leg then gently cups his head. He dab the gash on Ellis' forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he gonna be okay?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just need to get him to a clinic! Is there still one in town?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the closest?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna need your bike!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you bit?! Mud shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He holds Ellis as they move steadily up river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flat bottom boat approaches the riverbank. Neckbone points to the sandy ridge and yells up to Mud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My bike should be just over that ridge! Mud looks at Ellis' leg. The swelling has crept up his thigh. Black lines with numbers mark its progress: "428, 438, 448". Ellis' face has taken on a blue tint. 108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat hasn't reached the shore, but Mud takes Ellis in arms and jumps into the water. He wades onto the bank.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BIKE, 123
dialogues.text: Mud straddles it, turning Ellis' body so they are face to face. He cranks the bike and speeds away. Neckbone makes it to the top of the ridge in time to see disappear into the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud speeds the dirt bike down the two-lane highway. He's too big for the bike and it's even trickier balancing Ell Coming up on a slow moving pick-up overloaded with junk, veers into the opposing lane. ONCOMING TRAFFIC. Mud darts back to his lane in time to miss a semi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MALE NURSE(36) wheels an ELDERLY MAN through the slidin double front doors of a small clinic. Mud appears around the corner. The bike speeding toward t entrance. In a fluid motion, Mud takes Ellis in his arms and lifts leg over the bike. The bike tilts and slides across the pavement, smacking solidly into the curb. Mud has managed to stay on his feet with the boy in his a and rushes through the automatic front doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reception area has a DOZEN PATIENTS sitting in it. A check-in desk to the left. Mud holds Ellis out in his arm

dialogues.speaker: I NEED HELP HERE
dialogues.text: A FEMALE NURSE rushes out of the check-in area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just stay calm. What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been snake bit. ANOTHER NURSE rushes off calling for a doctor. The room becomes more frenzied. Patients talking. Nurses shouting. 109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's snake bit. A cotton mouth. On his calf. Just under an hour. As quickly as Mud gets this out, a GROUP of NURSES rush o of a door at the end of the room pushing a gurney. They take Ellis from Mud's arm, place him on the gurney, speed him into the back of the clinic. The commotion gone, the reception area feels oddly still. Mud takes a deep breath. He looks to his right. Patients stare at him. He's beyond disheveled. He's crazy looking. Mud turns to his left. The Male Nurse stares at him. For the first time, Mud realizes he's out in the open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir? Mud slowly backs up.

dialogues.speaker: MALE NURSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sir? We're gonna need some information? Mud backs out of the automatic doors. The entire room sta at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud is outside. The glass doors close. He nervously check over his shoulders. He spots a bank of trees just down fr the clinic. He heads for them. The front doors slide open and the Male Nurse walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?! Mud hops into the bank of trees and disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Patients in the reception area settle back into their seats and discuss the commotion. The Male Nurse enters and walks behind the check-in windo

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WINDOW,
dialogues.text: The Male Nurse fingers through a pile of papers. 110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He removes one of the fliers that Carver and his men have been showing. The Nurse studies the photo, looking back a the front doors. He picks up the phone and dials the number at the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the adjoining room, the phone rings. King steps throug the doorway, takes a seat on the bed, and answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...Yes...Yessir we are...Uh huh. King takes a pen from his shirt pocket and scribbles on a on the nightstand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now where'd you say you were?...Okay...He's gone. Okay...But you say he left the boy?...And your name sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun has been down for awhile. Juniper leans on the railing outside her room taking long drags from a cigaret She sees Miller's green pick-up parked below. Suddenly the headlights pop on and the truck pulls away. watches, curious, as it speeds out of sight. A train whistle blows in the distance but is overtaken by semi rumbling down the street. She watches the semi pass revealing the DAY/NITE Gas Station's parking lot. A130 MUD STANDS IN THE CORNER OF THE LOT. Half lit by a s lamp, he stares up at her. Juniper raises up. Even in the dim light she knows it's h She doesn't move. Mud holds up a hand, waves. Juniper slowly waves back. She tries to smile at him, but she's about to cry and it' hard to muster. Mud smiles. After a long moment, he turns his back and disappears in the shadows at the side of the gas station. Juniper watches after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The night sky is dark purple. An unnatural color. 111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis is on his back. Eyes closed. His head jostles at th SOUND of THUMPING. More THUMPING. It sounds like the hood of a car denting in. His eyes open. He stares up at an absurdly full moon. It' so bright it totally silhouettes the tree branches overhe The THUMPING continues. Ellis puts his hands on the edge the flat-bottom boat he's floating in and pulls himself u He leans over the side to see what's causing the noise. The water is jet black. The entire bayou pulsates. Ellis' eyes grow wide as the THUMPING reveals itself. THE BAYOU IS FILLED TO THE BRIM WITH SNAKES. The moonlight illuminates their shiny black backs as they twist and churn in what seems like one giant ball of snak Ellis lies back in the boat bringing his arms close to hi chest. He flinches at each THUMP. His eyes squeeze shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes open. Ellis bolts up in bed covered in a cold sweat. Mary Lee places a palm on his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. You're okay. Just set back. Mary Lee guides Ellis back down on the pillow. Senior sta with his arm on her shoulder. They look down at their son

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're home. We got you home. Ellis takes a second to get his bearings. His mother lift glass of Sprite up to his mouth. He takes a sip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had us scared son. Senior steps forward and kisses Ellis on the forehead. Staying close to his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so glad you're okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctors gave you some medicine. You had a snake bite. 112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd I get to the doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man brought you in. No one knew him. Ellis tries to sit up in bed, but his mother stops him.

dialogues.speaker: MARY LEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's okay. You just need to rest up now. We can talk all about it later. Do you need anything? Are you hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Senior gently pats her shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Let's let him rest. Mary Lee touches Senior's hand on her shoulder. She stand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be back in to check on you but just try and sleep if you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Senior leads Mary Lee to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom? Dad? They turn back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love ya'll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We love you too Ellis. They exit the room. Ellis rests his head back on the pill and takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud and Neckbone shove against the back of the boat trail The wheels of the trailer rock at the edge of the bank's incline. Sheets of metal roofing taken from the shack Ell and Neckbone dismantled line a runway into the water. 113.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost there. The wheels finally turn over. The trailer rolls down the bank and splashes into the water. The boat shimmies. Mud and Neckbone follow the trailer into knee deep water shove on the boat. A final push jettisons it into the riv They step back as the boat drifts out. A rope tied to its back becomes taught as it stretches from a tree on shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun does shine on a dog's ass some days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't sunk yet. Mud smiles. He holds out his hand, which Neckbone slaps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish Ellis could see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Mud walks back on shore and collects his duffel bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I owe you your end of the deal. Mud removes the pistol from the back of his jeans. Neckbone's eyes light up. Mud hands it over and Neckbone immediately notices a hole where the clip is missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the bullets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deal was for the gun, not the bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Neckbone begrudgingly crams the pistol into the back of h pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got one last favor to ask you. Neckbone sucks his teeth. 114.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water gently laps at the side of Ellis' houseboat. The ba is quiet. From the darkness, Neckbone and Mud appear in the flat-bo boat. They paddle with their hands. Approaching in silenc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis stares at the ceiling, unable to sleep. A TAP comes from the window. Ellis sits up in bed. Mud pokes his head in. He whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Mud pulls his body through the window. It's tight but he manages to make it look somewhat graceful. Mud takes a qu survey of the dark room. Ellis begins to get out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, don't get up. Mud motions him back down and pulls the chair from the de over to the bed. They speak in hushed voices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neck brought me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neckbone sits in the flat-bottom tied off at the corner.

dialogues.speaker: FROM THE TREELINE ON SHORE,
dialogues.text: All EIGHT of the Bounty Hunters sit hunkered in the trees Carver squats next to a stump. He loads shotgun shells in a 12 gauge pump and motions for the others to fan out alo the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got the boat in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did? 115.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just now. Smooth sailin' from here on out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wish you coulda seen it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't feel right leavin' town without sayin' goodbye. There is an awkward moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry `bout what I said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No. You were right to be mad. You were right about a lot of things. I'm the one that's sorry. I shoulda never gotten ya'll into all this. I just didn't see any other way around it. But I couldn't leave without you knowin' I never lied about being your friend. I never lied about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't traffic in the truth too often. But I did love her. I do love her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She loves you too. She said it. This fact still strikes Mud. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just made mistakes. We both did. This is a hard life to keep up with. You can't blame her for gettin' tired of tryin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad says you can't count on women lovin' you. He says you can't trust it. 116.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true. Don't judge your life on all of our mistakes. You'll make plenty mistakes of your own, no need takin' on everybody else's. You're a good man Ellis. If you find a girl half as good, you'll be all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a good man too Mud. Mud smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm not. But maybe from here on out I can be... A SHOTGUN BLAST rips a fist-sized hole in the flimsy inte wall. Mud, as if by reflex, yanks Ellis from the sheets a shoves him under the bed. BOOM. BOOM. Bits of sheetrock fall like snow flakes as more holes bla through the bedroom wall. Mud flinches with each shot. He covers his own head with one hand and the boy with the ot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay put! JUST STAY UNDER THERE! The SOUND of shotgun shells being slipped into the chambe Mud gets to a crouch. Through the holes in the wall, Mud makes out Nelson, the fat bounty hunter, reloading his gu

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DEN, 138
dialogues.text: Nelson finishes reloading. The riddled bedroom wall hangs front of him. A door opens behind him. He swivels around. Senior, in a robe, rushes from his bedroom with a pistol leveled. He's met with a shotgun blast just above his hea Pellets nick his face. Senior hits the ground and elbows way back inside his bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIS
dialogues.text: Senior screams, his voice cracking.

dialogues.speaker: SENIOR, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (muffled through the wall)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move Ellis. Just stay put. They just want me. Through the holes Mud sees Nelson approaching Ellis' bedr He runs for the window at the foot of the bed. Another shotgun BLAST throws open the door as Mud leaps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud crashes headfirst onto the edge of the houseboat gras for anything to keep from sliding off. His hand catches a metal deck cleat. It bends under his weight but holds. Mud gets to his feet and is met by the tip of a rifle. Miller, the man from the cafe, stands poised to fire. Mud's hand slips to the back of his pants for his pistol. NOTHING. He looks to the flat-bottom tied at the far edge the boat. No sign of Neckbone. Miller's finger curls around the trigger. SUDDENLY, a BULLET snicks through Miller's neck. Mud flinches. Miller's hand comes up to his neck but can' hold the blood running from it. He topples into the water

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom Blankenship sits in the folding chair on the roof of houseboat. He shucks an empty shell from a HIGH-POWERED RIFLE complete with scope. The long suitcase from the pho in Tom's house sits open at his feet. It has compartments for the disassembled rifle. Tom quickly raises to a new firing position. He squints a eye, searching for another target. A141 From this vantage point, Ellis' houseboat is clearly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: partially lit by the two flood lights. FOUR other BOUNTY HUNTERS swarm the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still under the bed, Ellis tries to hold his breath as Nelson's boots step into the room. They pause for a momen before sluggishly struggling through the bedroom window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud rushes to untie the flat-bottom. 118.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BULLET splinters the corner of the dock sending shards wood into Mud's hand. He sees TWO more GUNMEN skirting toward him on the deck of the houseboat. Mud takes cover against the wall and finds the muzzle of Nelson's gun teetering out Ellis' window. He grabs the muzzle and yanks the shotgun free. Nelson, stuck in the window, looks up in time to take a r butt in the face. He falls back into the room unconscious

dialogues.speaker: ON THE RIVERBANK, 144
dialogues.text: James, the man with the mustache, holds Neckbone in a headlock trying to cover his mouth. Carver stands with hi shotgun leveled and fires at Mud.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BOAT, 145
dialogues.text: Mud ducks as Carver's shot takes out a chunk of siding. T SOUND of boots rush up the side of the boat. Mud, gun in hand, jumps back through Ellis' window.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE RIVERBANK, 146
dialogues.text: Carver turns to Neckbone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him go. James unhands the boy. Neckbone sprints into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. They move toward the houseboat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud gets to his feet, stepping over an unconscious Nelson his way to the bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still down there bud?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay put. Mud pops out of the bedroom into the den. 119.

dialogues.speaker: IN SENIOR'S BEDROOM, 148
dialogues.text: Mary Lee, curled under the bed, frantically dials the pho Senior, propped against the closed door, uses his undersh to dab the pellet wounds around his neck. Hearing footsteps, he cracks the door open. He sees Mud standing in the den. Senior cocks his pistol

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DEN, 149
dialogues.text: The front door is KICKED open. Mud dives behind a Lazy Bo as a Bounty Hunter fires through the doorway. The back of the Lazy Boy explodes in fluff and fabric. Mu raises up to return fire, forcing the Man back out the do Mud crouches back behind the Lazy Boy. Unbeknownst to him another MAN appears outside two sliding glass doors. The raises his rifle at Mud. One of Tom's bullets rips through the Man's chest and shatters the glass door. Mud flinches. Another Hunter ste into the now broken door frame. Mud FIRES the shotgun, blowing the man into the patio grill. A149 Mud can see Tom's houseboat silhouetted across the A bayou. A muzzle FLASH sparks from the top of Tom's boat. This makes Mud smile. 150 The Front Door kicks open again and more pellets shat through the den. Mud raises to return fire. ONE SHOT, TWO, the third is a dead CLICK. He drops back behind the chair, out of shells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carver steps across the plank onto the houseboat followed James. Carver motions him around back toward Ellis' windo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flush him out this way. Carver walks to the covered carport.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DEN,
dialogues.text: The Hunters at the front door continue taking pot shots a the furniture. Mud flinches at each new round fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis cautiously slides out from under his bed and crouch next to the bedroom door. He peeks through a crack. He sees Mud pinned behind the Lazy Boy. They make eye contact. Mud's eyes move to something behind Ellis. Ellis turns to see James passing by his bedroom window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom scans Ellis' boat through the scope on his rifle. He sees Carver creeping around the carport. He pans right to find James taking a position near the patio doors. Tom pauses, seeing Ellis appear at the corner of the boat just behind James.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The firing from the front door has stopped. Mud takes a d breath, sets the empty shotgun on the ground, then rushes the sliding glass doors as the men out front reload.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud makes it outside, his back to James' leveled rifle.

dialogues.speaker: MUD
dialogues.text: James and Mud both turn at the sound of Ellis' voice. One Tom's bullets drops James dead. Carver appears at the carport end of the boat. He raises shotgun toward Mud.

dialogues.speaker: A156 ON TOM, A156
dialogues.text: He snaps the bolt open and closed, but it jams. He jerks the lever, looking up he sees Carver taking aim.

dialogues.speaker: ON MUD, 157
dialogues.text: Mud takes a running leap off the side of the boat. Carver FIRES. Mud is struck in the back by the shotgun blast. The force the shot spins him in the air. He crashes into the water. Ellis screams.

dialogues.speaker: MUD
dialogues.text: Carver approaches the edge of the boat. He stares down in the swirling dark water. No sign of Mud. 121.

dialogues.speaker: A157 ON TOM, A157
dialogues.text: Tom slaps open the bolt and yanks the spent cartridge out with his fingers. It BURNS.

dialogues.speaker: ON CARVER,
dialogues.text: He pumps the shotgun and fires into the murky water. The pellets pepper the surface. Still no sign of Mud. Carver pumps the shotgun a final time, but before he can another shot off Tom's bullet rips open Carver's chest sending him sprawling through the broken patio doors.

dialogues.speaker: ON TOM,
dialogues.text: He exhales, shucks the bolt once more. His eyes scan the dark water.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE HOUSEBOAT, 158
dialogues.text: Ellis runs to the edge of the boat.

dialogues.speaker: MUD
dialogues.text: Senior exits the houseboat, pistol pointed. He sees Ellis and runs to him.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIS
dialogues.text: Senior grabs the boy, keeping his pistol up. Ellis drops his knees and Senior crouches with him, holding him tight his arms. Ellis cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. It's okay. The two sit alone on the edge of the houseboat. The river seems especially quiet now.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. ELLIS' HOUSEBOAT/RIVERBANK
dialogues.text: The sky shows faint signs of morning, a few streaks of li

dialogues.speaker: ON THE RIVERBANK,
dialogues.text: The blue, red, and white lights from police cruisers and ambulances bounce up into the trees. A frenzy of Police activity swarms from the aftermath lef Ellis' houseboat. Men in wetsuits prepare a dive. Blanket covered bodies are wheeled off on gurneys. 122.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two of the Bounty Hunters, unharmed, sit locked in the ba of a state trooper vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE HOUSEBOAT, 160
dialogues.text: Ellis, Senior and Mary Lee sit huddled together under the carport. They watch the emergency workers stream past. Senior wraps his arms around them. Ellis looks across the bayou to Tom's boat. Police flashlights bob and weave throughout. No sign of Tom.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE ELLIS' HOUSEBOAT, 161
dialogues.text: A LOCAL OFFICER strings caution tape across the broken pa doors. TWO STATE TROOPERS hover over Carver's body. The Troopers step away and the Local Officer cranes towar the body. He studies Carver's face. Stepping aside, the Officer takes a cell phone from his pocket and dials. He turns his back away from the Trooper

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rings in the Pines Motel. King enters from the adjoining room and takes a seat on the bed. He answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...You're speaking to him... King listens. His face taut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead? (a long pause) Okay. King hangs up the phone. He sits at the edge of the bed, overwhelmed by the news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark on the river. Moonlight barely shows the ripple in the slow moving current. MUSIC from a country station slips out across the surface of the water. Galen's jambox sits next to a small lantern in his flat- bottom boat. His Helper snores, fully reclined, with an empty can of Budweiser resting on his gut. His feet are propped next to a tiny bell rigged to a line that disappears into the water. The bell RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: RIVER
dialogues.text: The river bed swirls inside two, distinct spots of light. 123.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen, using his new diving lights, scoops a final mussel shell into the net before tying it off. He tugs at the li It's pitch black save for the shafts of light projected f Galen's shoulders. He tilts the lights toward the surface The line leading up to the bottom of the boat dances in a out of the high beams. Then... MUD'S BODY FLOATS BY OVERHEAD. Only his backside is visible. A cloud of blood trails fro the holes there. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WORKER cinches a thick strap across the deck of Ellis' houseboat.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE RIVERBANK, 166
dialogues.text: Ellis watches as WORKERS affix straps from his houseboat crane resting in the bed of a large truck on the bank. The SOUND of Neckbone's dirt bike rattles through the tre He appears behind Ellis and parks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got your bike back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud dinged the shit out of it. Neckbone takes a seat next to Ellis. They watch the worke

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're really doin' it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bullshit. They ever find Tom? The boys focus on Tom Blankenship's boat across the bayou It sits vacant, covered in police tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dad not here? 124.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Said he couldn't watch it. He's pickin' me up in a minute. Got deliveries today. They sit in silence as the Workers exit off the houseboat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heard on the news. They still hadn't found Mud's body. Ellis nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he's dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I hope not. The crane begins lifting up the houseboat. The metal wire tighten and the entire structure creaks. A sucking sound as the flotilla separate from the water. boat hangs, suspended in the air. A HORN HONKS behind the boys. Ellis turns to see Senior's truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go. Come by the apartment. Help me set my room up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Neckbone watches Ellis climb into the bed of the pick-up take his spot on the coolers. The sound of twisting metal shifts his attention back to the houseboat being swung ov flatbed semi.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CAB,
dialogues.text: Senior glances at the houseboat being set on the flatbed. puts the truck in reverse and pulls away. Not looking bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis rides in the back of the truck on top of the coolers. He watches the town pass by. A168 The marina junkyard. The Sonic. Downtown. A168 125.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis and his father unload a cooler at the back of a ten flea market. A WOMAN comes out to greet them.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. SENIOR'S TRUCK/NEW APARTMENTS
dialogues.text: Senior's truck pulls into the parking lot of a newly fini apartment complex. The two-story buildings are modest. The truck idles out front.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CAB,
dialogues.text: Ellis grabs the door handle. He turns to Senior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you next week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Ellis begins to get out but stops when Senior speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis? You mind your mother okay? This is a big change for her. She needs your support.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love you too. Ellis climbs out. He watches as Senior pulls away. He stands alone in front of the apartments, studying the surroundings. A busy road out front. A gas station and collection of stores. A lot of people and commotion. A compact car pulls into a parking spot one building down Ellis watches as three COLLEGE AGE GIRLS climb out dresse running shorts and t-shirts. Two are heavy set, the other petite. They joke and laugh. One sees Ellis and waves. Ellis nods to her. He tracks them as they walk inside. Ellis smirks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The river rushes past. A large motor churns the water. 126.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom stands steering Mud's salvaged boat down river. He cranes his neck, seeing something up ahead. Tom kills the motor. Looking out over the bow, he's pleas by what he sees. His eyes glint, almost a smile. He walks to the small cabin and enters.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CABIN, 171
dialogues.text: Mud rests flat on his stomach on the cushioned bench. Shirtless, gauze bandages wrap around his chest and back. He's sleeping. Tom walks in and kneels next to him. Touches his shoulder Mud's eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on son. You need to see this. Mud, groggy, raises up. Tom helps him to his feet, puttin an arm over his shoulders. Tom practically carries Mud outside.

dialogues.speaker: ON DECK, 172
dialogues.text: Tom and Mud slowly maneuver out the door and take a place near the front of the boat. Mud pulls his head up. Looks out ahead. The sight in fron of him grabs his attention. He perks up. A tributary from the Mississippi river opens up into a va stretch of ocean. Mud smiles, showing the missing tooth. Tom and Mud stand on deck as their boat drifts slowly int the open waters of the Gulf of Mexico. The End.
